She indicates that she is doing well and that used clothing is well accepted and cheaper, reason why people prefer it.  She is requesting the loan to buy second hand clothing for sale, as this way she will be able to have good variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothing for sale.

loans.name: Santosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KOSÑIPATA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Maranura, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Santosa se dedica al negocio de agricultura, ella tiene un terreno donde cultiva cacao,naranjas y café, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 3:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Santosa is a member of the Communal Bank “Kosñipata” which is located in the District of Maranuara in La Convención Province, Department of Cusco. She is in the business of farming and owns a plot of land on which she grows cacao, oranges, and coffee. Santosa works from 6:00 A.M. to 3:00 P.M. She has been in this business for several years and is doing very well. Her dream is to expand her plot of farmland.

Santosa is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds and fertilizers. She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mujeres De Trinidad Group

texts.es:
Cada una de las señoras de este grupo quiere crecer y fortalecer su economía y por medio de su trabajo ayudar a sus familias, forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que les ayudará a conocer la situación de cada una y conforme a ello poder mejorar sus vidas.
Una persona que se destaca es Lucia, una mujer que no se deja vender, y que lucha y se esfuerza más cada día, ella vende comidas que hace y luego sale a vender de manera ambulante. A sus clientes gusta mucho lo que hace, ya que siempre tiene muy ricas comidas.
Lucia pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, condimentos, hortalizas, panificados, y demás, ya que de esa manera podrá seguir haciendo sus comidas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Each of the members of this group wants to grow and strengthen their economy and help their families through their work, they are part of the program to eliminate poverty, which will help them understand and get to know each situation and through that improve their lives.
One of the member is Lucia, she is a women that doesn't let herself get down and she works hard each day, she sells food that she prepares and then goes out to sell in the street.  Her clients really like what she makes because it's always really good food.  Lucia is requesting a loan to buy vegetables, condiments, fruit, bread and other.  This way she will continue to make food and sell as she has been in the past.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, fruit, bread and others.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
La Sra. Nilda es una persona muy trabajadora, enviudó muy joven, quedó con dos hijos que tenía que sacar adelante, una nena y un varón.
La señora se dedica a la cría de animales y hace dos años que formo para su despensa, y por medio de su trabajo está teniendo los medios para poder ayudar a su familia y sus seres queridos.
Nilda solicita el préstamo para surtir más aún su despensa y así incrementar más aun sus ingresos, ya que quiere comprar verduras, frutas, carnes, bebidas y demás.
texts.en: Nilda is a hard working person. She became a widow when she was very young, with two children she had to bring up, a girl and a boy. Nilda works raising animals, and two years ago she opened a grocery store. Thanks to her work she has the means to help her family and loved ones. Nilda is asking for a loan to better stock her store and increase her profits. She wants to buy vegetables, fruits, meats, beverages, etc.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, fruits, meats, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor is 60 years old and the father of four children. He lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines.  He has run his retail store for many years. With his income, he has successfully repaid his previous loans used for this business. To increase sales, he took a new loan recently to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

He wants to improve the business as well the general living situation of the entire family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Virgen De Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
Virgen de las Mercedes está en su quinto ciclo, son 18 mujeres que tienen la esperanza de poder capacitarse y dar a sus seres queridos mejor calidad de vida. Existen un total de 18 mujeres que cuentan diversas actividades comerciales.
Liliana es parte de este grupo, ella es una persona muy emprendedora que está luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Ella es empleada y también está procurando salir adelante en la venta de ropas ya que así podrá tener unos mejores ingresos.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas variadas ya que así podrá seguir con sus ventas, y luchando por mejorar.
texts.en:
Virgen de las Mercedes is in its fifth cycle. They are a group of 18 women who hope to empower themselves and give their loved ones a better quality of life. In total, they are 18 women with a wide variety of business activities.

Liliana is part of this group. She is a very enterprising person who is fighting to improve her living conditions. She is employed, and is also working to get ahead by selling clothing, since this will allow her to have a better income.

She is requesting this loan in order to be able to invest it in the purchase of a variety of clothing. This will allow her to continue with her sales and her struggle to improve her life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Irfan

texts.en:
Irfan is a 30-year-old married man living along with his wife and a kid in the area of Lalamusa, Pakistan. He is a farmer by profession and cultivates various crops according to the weather, climate, season and demand. He wants to start a tailoring business because he has to wait a long time to sell his crops. He wants to buy a sewing machine to start a business he does not have enough cash in hand to buy it. Therefore, Irfan has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. In this way, he can easily generate some income to cherish his family.

Irfan thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for tailoring.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to purchase more varieties and larger quantities of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and her personal household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her business profits will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Helena dreams for her business to grow and prosper. She hopes that her family will always be healthy and that they will have time to go to church. She meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 54 years old, single, and works hard to support her family.

She has a ice-cream business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Nida is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stocks of ice cream and spare parts for the maintenance of her bicycle for her ice-cream business.

Nida has sustained her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of ice cream and spare parts for the maintenance of her bicycle.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit lives in Tairov village in the Armavir region with her 19-year-old daughter. She has been involved in clothing sales for many years. Specifically, Anahit, from her house, sells clothing to locals in the town. As a new educational year starts, Anahit needs more funds to be able to acquire new stock of clothing as the demand for it rises.
 
The requested loan will help her to purchase new stock of women's and school clothing and meet her customers' demands.
 
The loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of women's and school clothing

loans.name: Nuestra Señora De La Asuncion Group

texts.es:
Nuestra Señora de la Asunción es un grupo de la ciudad de Itá, es muy numeroso, y está en su ciclo número 5 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para ir mejorando el estilo de vida de cada una.
Maria es modista, una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, que por medio de su trabajo está luchando para dar a su familia todo lo que no pudieron tener. Maria tiene una clientela bien formada que conoce su trabajo, es por ello que siempre le acercan pedidos de todo tipo de prendas.
Maria pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, e hilos, que le permitirá seguir con los pedidos de sus clientes, y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. Cada una de las integrantes agradece por la oportunidad que reciben de mejorar sus vidas.
texts.en:
The community group "Nuestra Senora de la Asuncion" is very numerous. They are on the fifth cycle of the "Women's committee" program, in which they all work and help each other to get ahead in life. They are doing the survey to eliminate poverty, to improve the lifestyle of each of them.
Maria is a seamstress, a hard-working and striving woman who, through her work, is fighting to provide for her family everything they couldn't have. Maria has a well formed clientele who knows her work and that is why they come to her with orders for all types of clothes. Maria is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of fabric and threads which will allow her to fulfill her customers' orders and to improve the quality of life for her and her family. All the members of the group are grateful for the opportunity to improve their lives.

loans.use: Comprar telas e hilos.

loans.name: Rejane

texts.en:
Rejane is a married, 24-year-old mother who lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. Her husband is a businessman. She helps in their business of buying and selling crabs. With her generated income, she successfully repaid her previous loans used for the business. Always wanting to improve the business to secure better income for the family, she took a new loan recently to buy more seafood to sell.
 
She wants to improve the general living conditions of her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Deyvis Junior

texts.es:
Deyvis es un joven padre de familia dedicado, tiene 20 años de edad y vive en Imperial junto a su familia.
Su pequeño es su razón en la vida para salir adelante, gracias a él lucha día  a día porque quiere brindarle mayores oportunidades en la vida. Desde hace varios años viene desempeñando el cargo de pintor en una gran empresa y le va muy bien porque trabaja con ética y pone en práctica todos los valores con los cuales fue educado.
Deyvis quiere mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, es por ello que está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar un jugo de sala para su domicilio, para que de esta manera su familia viva en un lugar más cómodo, gracias a esto Deyvis seguirá luchando para poder sacar adelante a su familia y más adelante poder comprarse su casa propia.
texts.en:
Deyvis is a young man who is a dedicated father. He is 20 years old and lives with his family in Imperial. His young one is his reason to get ahead in life. Thanks to his son, Deyvis strives each day because he wants to provide him with greater opportunities in life. For several years, he has been working as a painter for a large company. He is doing very well because he conducts his work ethically and puts into practice all of the values that were instilled in him.

Deyvis wants to improve his family’s quality of life. For this reason, he is very grateful to the Kiva lenders. As a result of their support, he will able to purchase a living room set for his home. This will allow his family to live more comfortably. Deyvis continues to push forward so that he can succeed on behalf of his family. Later on, he would like to buy a house of his own.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his home.

loans.name: Barbara

texts.es:
Barbara proviene de una humilde familia de la compañía de la ciudad de San Ignacio, ella es una persona muy trabajadora, con ganas de salir adelante para mejor ingreso económico y así poder ayudar a su familia.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, ya que quiere ser una profesional útil a las demás personas y a la sociedad misma.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Barbara comes from a humble family from the city of San Ignacio. She is a hard working person, eager to get ahead to earn a higher income and thus be able to help her family.
She is studying for a degree in business administration because she wants to be a professional useful to other people and to society itself. She is asking for this loan to pay the university tuition fees and be able to keep studying.

loans.use: to pay university tuition fees.

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en: Rhodora is married with three children. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She owns and operates an agricultural farm to earn a living. She has been in her business for 10 years earning well for the family. She joined GDMPC to gain access to finances for her business. She has successfully repaid her previous loans used for farming. To maintain the farm, she took a new loan recently to purchase organic fertilizer in order to restore her farm nutrients. Her hopes and dreams are to have a better future and improve her living situation.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer to restore farm nutrients

loans.name: Bobur

texts.en:
Bobur lives in a village. He is 18 years old. Bobur is a student of the first course at Tajikistan State University. He studies at the faculty of finance and credit. He studies full time. Bobur likes to read books and analyze them. He has read many books. 

Bobur lives with his parents. He is happy and loves his parents. They live together in an amicable atmosphere. 

He is asking for a loan because he must pay for his tuition. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz es estudiante de la Carrera de Veterinaria, actualmente se encuentra cursando el último semestre. 
Vive en un departamento en alquiler con sus algunas compañeras, trabaja en una Veterinaria como Auxiliar su deseo es ser una excelente doctora en lo que concierne su profesión salvando vidas de muchos animales, proyecta para el año 2015 estudiar un post-grado de preservación de vida en extinción de animales exóticos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de su titulación, ya que así podrá cubrir ese gasto que tiene. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en:
Liz is studying to become a veterinary. She is studying her final semester. She lives in a rental apartment with some classmates and works as an assistant at a veterinary clinic. Her wish is to become an excellent veterinary doctor and save many animal lives. In 2015 she is planning to study a post-grad degree in preserving the life of exotic animals in danger of extinction.
Liz is asking for a loan to pay the final fees to get her degree. She is grateful for the opportunity afforded to her.

loans.use: to pay final fees to register her degree.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
Sergio está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, comenta que su meta futura es poder terminar con éxito la carrera y poder seguir estudiando otras carreras para poder incrementar sus conocimientos y seguir adelante con el nuevo negocio que estoy empezando a levantar.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus gastos de titulación, ya que así podrá cubrir este gasto que tiene.
texts.en:
Sergio is studying for a degree in business administration. His future goal is to finish his studies successfully and to keep studying other degrees to increase his knowledge and move ahead the business he is starting to build.
Sergio is asking for a loan to pay the final fees to register his diploma.

loans.use: to pay the final fees to get his degree.

loans.name: Cristo Salvador Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por 7 personas  responsables a distintas actividades comerciales. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal. “CRISTO SALVADOR” una de ellas es la Sra. MARIA  de 60 años casada   y con 3  hijos mayores de edad, la Sra. María   se dedica ya hace 4 año a la venta de ropa usada  tanto para damas como para caballeros en un pequeño mercado todos los días con el merito de salir adelante, Con el fruto de su esfuerzo la Sra. maría   ha logrado mejorar su vivienda con la ayuda de su esposo y así  Seguir mejorando su negocio, su mayor deseo es que sus hijos sean profesionales es por eso  que la Sra. María    trabaja mucho, Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más ropa  para su posterior venta y  tener más ingresos económicos. La Sra. María  se le distingue por su chompa de color verde y  chaleco negro, la vez se despide con un abraso a Kiva y Edaprospo y  agradece el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso.
texts.en:
This group consists of seven responsible individuals who engage in different business activities. They are the members of the Communal Bank “Cristo Salvador” (Christ the Savior).

One of the members is Sra. María. She is 60 years old, married, and has three grown children. Sra. María has been selling used clothes, for both women and men, at a small market for the past four years. Every day her goal is to get ahead. As a result of her efforts, Sra. María has been able to make improvements to her home with the help of her husband. She has also been able to improve her business. Her greatest wish is to see her children become professionals. For this reason, Sra. María works very hard.

The loan that has been issued to her will be used to buy more clothes for eventual resale. This will help her to generate more income. In the photo, Sra. María is wearing a green sweater and a black vest. She bids farewell with a hug to Kiva and EDAPROSPO because she is grateful for this loan that makes it possible for her to progress.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en:
Rodelyn has been operating her own transportation-service-based business for more than a year, and she earns well from this. Being a single mom of two, she needs to make more effort to provide for the needs, especially of her children. She has to work hard with the determination of having better income to provide her children a better education she didn't have. 

To improve the service, she took a new loan from GDMPC Micro Credit to repair her existing vehicle. In the future, Rodelyn hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair her existing vehicle

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 31 years old and married with one child in school. Rachel works very hard to provide for the family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Rachel has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, Rachel would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Guilhermina

texts.en:
Guilhermina started her business in 2010 with working capital of $50. She is married, and she has four children. Her husband is a farmer. Now she is applying for a loan of $600. She is taking this loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk, such as slippers, candies, sugar, coffee, aqua, cooking oils, detergent and other things to sell, including soft drinks. 

She is happy with the loan that is offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her, and she hopes to open a big store in the future. In the house, she has animals like cows, buffalos, pigs, chicken and goats.

loans.use: To buy slippers, candies, sugar, coffee, aqua, cooking oils, detergent and other things to sell, including soft drinks.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria es soltera pero tiene un hijo y vive con su madre en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento donde paga un alquiler Maria es comerciante y vende productos en la puerta de un salón de fiestas. El método de trabajo de Maria consiste en vender articulos baratos como juegos de vasos, frazadas, tazas y vajilla en general a las personas que asisten al salon y que no pudieron comprar un regalo (los salones en La Paz se usan para cumpleaños de personas mayores, graduaciones escolares, etc)Por eso, Maria necesita un credito para comprar mercaderia como tazas, frazadas e inclusive arreglos florales naturales y artificiales Maria es la unica persona que sustenta el hogar pero goza de buena salud
texts.en:
Maria is single, but she has one child. She lives with her mother in a rented house made of brick and cement, which is located in La Paz. Maria is a merchant and sells her products at the entrance of an events hall. Her work method consists of selling inexpensive items such as drinking glass sets, blankets, cups, and dishes to people who arrive at the hall but were not able to buy a gift. Events halls in La Paz are used for adult birthday parties, school graduations, and other special occasions.

For this reason, Maria needs a loan in order to buy merchandise such as cups, blankets, and floral arrangements (both natural and artificial). Maria is the only breadwinner in her home, so she is in good health.

loans.use: to buy cups, blankets, and floral arrangements to sell.

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Sadia is 55 and the mother of four children living in Taxila. She is a hardworking woman and is self-employed. She started selling clothes in order to help her husband to cover their family expenses. She has 10 years of experience in this business. Now her business is running well, and she has made many loyal customers. She is friendly and nice to everyone. Her contribution has helped her family to raise their standard of living. She is a role model for other women in her community. 

Now she wants to sell more trendy and variety of clothes to her customers. Therefore, she has requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva partner, to buy clothes and increase sales and earn profits.

loans.use: To buy new and trendy clothes to increase her clothes-selling business.

loans.name: Rosa Luz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KOSÑIPATA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Maranura, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Rosa Luz  se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de frutas , la socia lleva a diferentes lugares, la socia vende naranjas,platanos y manadarinas, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las frutas . La socia solicita el crédito para comprar naranjas,platanos y manadarinas . 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rosa Luz is a member of the Communal Bank “Kosñipata” which is located in the District of Maranuara in La Convención Province, Department of Cusco. She continues to manage her business of selling fruit. Rosa Luz travels to different places in order to sell oranges, bananas, and tangerines. She has been in this business for several years and is doing very well. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell fruit.

Rosa Luz is requesting a loan in order to buy oranges, bananas, and tangerines. She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy oranges, bananas, and tangerines.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, ham, cheese, and more to make food.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru:
Саодат в первую очередь хотела бы поблагодарить МДО Арванд и конечно же кредиторам Кива за поддержку. В очередной раз Саодат взяла кредит для расширения и улучшения своего бизнеса. В сезон закруток потребности к национальным приправам и банок у  местности растут, так как летом все занимаются заготовкой к зиме. Саодат конечно в сезон хотела бы получить немного дохода от продажи и на эти деньги помочь сыну, хоть как то хочет добавить свою долю на свадьбу внука, они решили в этом году сделать ему обрезание.
  Она оптом закупает и привозит товары с города и продает их в розницу на местном рынке. Саодат имеет большой опыт в этой сфере. Она продает товары по сезону и по потребности местного населения. Саодат благодаря своему небольшому бизнесу улучшила семейную жизнь и помогает внукам в получение  образования.  Пока сезон на рынке в разгаре Саодат хочет еще немного привезти банки и товары для закруток, но ей не хватает денежных средств для покупки товаров поэтому она решила в очередной раз взять кредит. Саодат очень рада что и в наших странах есть такие организации где своевременно оказывают финансовую помощь и поддерживают начинающих предприниматель.
texts.en:
First of all, Saodat wanted to thank MDO Arvand and of course Kiva lenders for support. Yet another time, Saodat obtained a loan to expand and improve her business. The demand for national spices and jars increases among local residents during the canning season because everyone is getting ready for the winter during the summer time. Saodat, of course, wants to earn some income from sales during the season, and use this money to help her son and add her contribution to her grandson's wedding; they decided to do a circumcision for him this year.

She buys merchandise wholesale and delivers it from a city and sells it retail at a local market. Saodat has a lot of experience in this area. She sells merchandise seasonally and according to local residents' demand. Thanks to her small business, Saodat improved her family life and helps her grandsons with obtaining education. While the season is hot, Saodat wants to bring in more jars and goods for canning, but does not have enough money to buy merchandise, and this is why she decided to obtain a loan again. Saodat is very happy that such organizations that provide timely financial help and support starting entrepreneurs exist in our countries.

loans.use: to buy jars and supplies for canning

loans.name: Melchora

texts.es:
La Sra. Melchora trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano, en su despensa, es una mujer muy luchadora que quiere salir adelante por medio de su trabajo y su esfuerzo. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso para poder surtir su negocio.
Hoy pide un nuevo préstamo que quiere invertir en la compra de carnes, bebidas, productos a granel y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Sra. Melchora works every day at her food pantry, beginning in the early morning hours. She is a very determined woman who wants to get ahead as a result of her work and effort. Melchora says that her previous loan was used to restock her business.

Today she is requesting a new loan so that she can invest in the purchase of meats, beverages, and other products in bulk. This will enable her to continue her work just as before.

loans.use: to buy meats, beverages, and other products in bulk.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Emprendedoras se llama este grupo, es un comité nuevo, donde todas las integrantes están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder salir adelante. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, que les permitirá conocer la situación de cada una.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Ilse, quien está empezando en el grupo. Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que es vendedora de ropas Only, donde se destaca el esfuerzo que está poniendo por poder mejorar las condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas, y de esa forma poder seguir con su trabajo luchando por un mejor día a día.
texts.en:
This group calls itself Mujeres Emprendedoras (Entrepreneurial Women); it is a new committee where the members are putting their great strength to be able to move forward. They are working towards the elimination of poverty, which allows them to understand the situation of every person.
One of the members is Señora Ilse, who is just starting in the group. The work she does is the sale of clothing, and she is highlighted for the work that she is using to be able to improve her living conditions, and those of her family.
She is asking this loan to be able to buy various garments, with which she will be able to continue with her work and fighting for a better day, every day.

loans.use: to buy garments to sell.

loans.name: Ulyses

texts.en:
His name is Ulyses. He is married and has one daughter in college. He is into a soft drinks business, and his income is a big help in his personal, household and business expenditures. He is thankful for the previous loans that was granted to him by  Kiva.

He would like to apply for another loan in the amount of 55,000 PHP (Philippines pesos), which he will use as additional working capital for his soft drink business. In addition to soft drinks, he also sells footwear and plasticware. His earnings definitely help sustain his family's daily needs and the educational needs of his daughter. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Ulyses plans to grow his business in the future and wishes his child to finish college. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for soft drinks that he will sell to customers.

loans.name: Renelyn

texts.en:
Renelyn is married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Renelyn is 38 years old and has four children who are in school.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Renelyn requested a 23,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fishing net.

Renelyn has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Renelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 40 years old and single with two children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Veronica is borrowing 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy an additional piglet, feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Veronica has been pig fattening for two years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional piglet, feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business making dried fish in the Philippines. Rebecca has been in this business for 35 years.

Rebecca requested a loan of 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fish to make dried fish. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to make dried fish.

loans.name: Abdugaffor

texts.ru: Абдугаффор мужчина в возрасте 63 года. Он трудолюбивый, понимающий человек, а иногда бывает строгим, так как он педагог. Своих детей он тоже воспитывал в строгости, чтоб в дальнейшем дети нашли свое место в обществе. Абдугаффор с женой свою жизнь посвятили детям, ради их благополучия.  На сегодняшней день дети Абдугаффора живут раздельно в своих домах, с ним остался младший сын и его жена. Они всей семьей живут очень дружно.  Невестка Абдугаффора швея она работает в ателье, а жена Адолат в школе работает техничкой. Сам Абдугаффор кроме школы, дополнительно еще занимается животноводством он выращивает крупно рогатых скатов .  Он имеет большой опыт в этой сфере, ведь он с детство помогал родителям в выхаживание скот, он вместе с отцом ходил на пастбище и т.д. и вот все его знания о животноводстве пошло ему на пользу. Абдугаффор в данное время имеет пару крупно рогатых скатов, и он еще хочет приобрести одного теленка и немного  корма для них. Но ему своих денег не хватает, поэтому он подал заявку на кредит. Абдугаффор выражает свою благодарность МДО Арванд за своевременную помощь и конечно же за поддержку.
texts.en: Abdugaffor is a 63-year-old man. He is a hardworking and understanding person, but can sometimes be strict because he is a teacher. He also raised his children with strictness so that the children could find their place in society in the future. Abdugaffor and his wife devoted their lives to their children, for their welfare. Today, Abdugaffor's children live separately in their own homes, and the youngest son and his wife live with the parents. They live happily together. Abdugaffor's daughter-in-law is a seamstress, working at an atelier, and Abdugaffor's wife works as a janitor at a school. Abdugaffor, besides school, is additionally involved in animal husbandry - he raises cattle. He has a lot of experience in this area because he used to help his parents care for livestock since his childhood. His father and he would go to a pasture, and all of his knowledge about animal husbandry became useful. At the present time, Abdugaffor has a pair of cows and wants to buy another calf and some livestock feed. He does not enough money for this, and this is why he requested a loan. Abdugaffor expresses his gratitude to MDO Arvand for the timely help and, of course, support.

loans.use: to buy another calf and livestock feed

loans.name: Navbahor

texts.ru: Навбахор молодая замужняя женщина в возрасте 22 лет. Она замужем за ветеринара. Сама Навбахор портниха, она на протяжении трех лет предоставляет услуги швеи. Одновременно Навбахор еще и занимается растениеводством при небольшом участке земли. Она с этих земель собрала корм для скотов. Навбахор решила отрыть еще один бизнес откорм-продажу скотов. И муж-ветеринар будет помогать ей в этом. Чтобы закупить самих скотов, она просит кредит, так как собственного начального капитала не хватает. Навбахор очень надеется на поддержку. Она старается ради финансового благополучия семьи.
texts.en: Navbahor is a young, married 22-year-old woman. She is married to a veterinarian. Navbahor is a seamstress - she has been providing sewing services for three years. At the same time, Navbahor is involved in agriculture on a small plot of land. She gathered livestock feed from this land. Navbahor decided to start another business, of reselling livestock. And her veterinarian husband would help her with this business. She is requesting this loan to buy livestock because she does not have enough of her own capital. Navbahor very much hopes for support. She tries hard for the family's financial welfare.

loans.use: to buy livestock and start another business

loans.name: Egamnazar

texts.ru: Эгамназар старый житель района Гончи. Ему 62 года. Он все еще работает журналистом на радио. А его жена работает в книжном магазине. У них двое сыновей, они обзаведены семьями и живут отдельно. Эгамназар на старости лет решил заняться новым бизнесом. Его давно интересовало животноводство. Теперь он хочет воплотить мечты в реальность. Он запасся кормом для скотов, а также имеет немного сбережений в размере около 200 долларов США. Эгамназар недостающую сумму просит в кредит. Он собирается закупить пару скотин и начать свой бизнес. Без вашей поддержки ему не обойтись.
texts.en: Egamnazar is an elderly resident of the Gonchi district. He is 62 years old. He still works as a radio journalist. And his wife works at a bookstore. They have two sons, both of whom have families and live separately. Egamnazar, at his age, decided to get involved in a new business. He has been interested in animal husbandry for a long time. Now he wants to make his dream a reality. He stocked up on livestock feed and also has some savings in the amount of 200 US dollars. Egamnazar is requesting the rest of the amount as a loan. He is planning to buy a couple of heads of livestock and start his business. He cannot do this without your help.

loans.use: to buy livestock and start his own business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As the married mother of three children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling root crops in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming peanuts and raising livestock. Teresita is borrowing PHP 35,000 through NWTF in order to buy a variety of root crops to sell to customers.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy a variety of root crops to sell to customers.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 38 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling nipa roofing material in the Philippines and requested a 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy more nipa to sell.

Judith has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the nipa roofing business for 10 years and also earns an income from rice farming and pig fattening.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more nipa roofing material to sell

loans.name: Lebeta

texts.en:
As the married parent of three children, Lebeta works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Lebeta is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice for retail for her rice retailing business.

Lebeta has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice for retail

loans.name: M.imran

texts.en:
M.Imran is a 28-year-old man living with his parents in the area of Lalamusa, Pakistan.

He owns a poultry farm near his hometown; he has many hens for producing eggs to sell. He supplies the eggs to the bakery, general stores and wholesalers. He wants to enhance his business to offer broilers as well. For this purpose, he wants to buy hens and poultry feed.

The eggs and broilers are the most demanded food items for the whole year. To cope with the demand and for getting maximum profit, he wants to buy more chicks for producing more eggs and broilers to sell. But due to household expenses, utility bills and miscellaneous expenses, he is unable to buy more hens. 

Therefore, M.Imran has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so he can buy more chicks and could generate maximum income for his family. M.Imran is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy chicks for producing eggs and broilers then reselling.

loans.name: Shoira

texts.ru: Шоира продавщица, проживающая в районе Спитамен. Ей 36 лет. Она замужем, у нее двое детей. Муж тоже занимается торговлей. Шоира начала свой бизнес 5 лет назад. Она занимается продажей детской одежды и ей это нравится. Шоира вежливая продавщица и умеет находить подход к каждому клиенту. Сейчас она хочет увеличить товарооборот и с этой целью обратилась за кредитом. Шоира собирается привезти сезонный товар для того, чтобы привлечь больше клиентов. Она нуждается в этом кредите.
texts.en: Shoira is a salesperson, living in the Spitamen district. She is 36 years old, married and has two children. Her husband is also involved in sales. Shoira started her business 5 years ago. She is involved in selling children's clothing and really likes it. Shoira is a polite salesperson and can find the right approach for every customer. Now she wants to increase her good turnover and requested a loan for this purpose. Shoira is planning to bring in seasonal merchandise in order to attract more customers. She needs this loan.

loans.use: to buy seasonal children's clothing for sale

loans.name: Marangatu Rape Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, es un comité que está luchando por poder salir adelante y por medio de la ayuda mutua.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lidia, quien se dedica a las compras y ventas de su negocio, ya que tiene una despensa bien surtida en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día, hasta muy tarde en la noche.
La Sra. Lidia pide este préstamo para la compra de bebidas como gaseosas, cervezas, caña, etc, lo que le ayudará a tener a surtir negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This group is working for the elimination of poverty. It's a committe that is fighting to move foward through mutual support.
One of the members is Señora Lidia, who buys and sells for her business, and already has a well-stocked dispensary in which she works every day from the very early morning hours of the day, until very late at night.
Señora Lidia asks this loan to buy beverages such as soda, beer, sugar cane, etc., which will help her fill her business, and improve her finances.

loans.use: to buy soda, beer, sugar cane, etc.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is a married woman and the mother of three children, from Dulag, Leyte. Gladys has been engaged in the hog raising business for more than 15 years now. This is the source of her income. Gladys is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed and supplements for the piglets. With this, she will be able to raise healthy pigs which she can then sell to the market. Gladys hopes to make her business a success and a sustainable source of income. in addition, Gladys wants to save money for the school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed and supplements for the piglets.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El grupo Oñondivepa está en su ciclo número 4° Del programa de comité de mujeres, donde ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Liz quien se dedica a la venta de bijouterie que con mucho trabajo hace para poder ganarse la vida de una manera honrada.
Liz es una persona muy emprendedora que quiere salir adelante y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. La Sra. Solicita de este préstamo para la compra bijouterie para vender, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
Todas las integrantes son mujeres jefas de familia que están luchando por sus familias y seres queridos.
texts.en:
The group Oñordivepa is in its 4th women's committee program cycle, where they are working towards the elimination of poverty, and of which one of the members is Señora Liz, who sells jewelry and works hard to be able to earn her living in an honorable manner.
Liz is a very entrepreneurial person who wants to move forward and improve the living conditions for her family. The Señora requests this loan to buy jewelry to sel, which will help her solidify her business plan, which will help her improve her finances.
All of the members are female heads of household that are fighting for their families and loved ones.

loans.use: to buy jewelry for resale.

loans.name: M.akram

texts.en:
M.Akram is the age of 45 and lives with his five children in the area of Lalamusa, Pakistan. 

He is a milkman by profession; he sells milk over a shop to the common people. His customers like the fresh and delicious milk he sells. His monthly net income is too low to meet the household needs because there are too many competitors in the market for the customers.

Due to his quality and reasonable rates, most of the customers like to buy milk from him. He wants to increase the stock on a daily basis and wants to buy milk in bulk, but he does not have enough cash in hand to buy milk in a large quantity. Therefore, M.Akram has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that he can be able to buy more milk to sell. 

M.Akram is very happy after receiving this loan; he thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy milk in bulk for reselling.

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.ru: Заррине 34 года. Она замужем, у нее трое сыновей в возрасте 12, 9 и 2 лет. Старшие сыновья ходят в школу. Заррина со своей семьей живет в городе Куляб. Она активная трудолюбивая женщина. Заррина на протяжении 6 лет занимается торговым бизнесом. Ее торговая точка расположена у дороги. Сейчас она на продажу выводит семечки, мороженное, и фрукты. Заррина хочет увеличить объем продаж. Поэтому она берет кредит, чтобы приобрести партию свежих фруктов для продажи. Этот кредит поможет привлечь больше клиентов и увеличить доход от продаж.
texts.en: Zarrina is 34 years old. She is married and has three sons, who are 12, 9 and 2 years old. The oldest sons attend a school. Zarrina and her family live in the town of Kulob. She an active and hardworking woman. Zarrina has been involved in a retail business for 6 years. Her retail outlet is located by a road. Now she sells seeds, ice-cream and fruits. Zarrina wants to increase her sales. This is why she is requesting this loan to buy fresh fruit for resale. This loan would help to attract more clients and increase the sales income.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits for resale

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru: Матлуба замужем за трудового мигранта. Ее муж уже в течение нескольких лет ездит в Россию на заработки и в данный момент он находится там, так как сейчас сезон работы. Матлуба живет в районе Спитамен с двумя дочерьми и сыном. Ей 31 год. Матлуба в течение 5 лет работает в сельском хозяйстве и одновременно занимается животноводством. Она разводит крупнорогатый скот. Матлуба собирается увеличить поголовье скотов в своем скотном дворе. С такой целью она запрашивает кредит. Она хочет продвинуть бизнес и увеличить семейный бюджет.
texts.en: Matluba is married to a migrant worker. Her husband has been going to Russia for work for several years and is currently there as well because this is a work season. Matluba lives in the Spitamen district with two daughters and son. She is 31 years old. Matluba has been working in agriculture for 5 years and also involved in animal husbandry. She raises cattle. Matluba is planning to increase the livestock headcount in her livestock yard. She is requesting a loan for this purpose. She wants to advance her business and increase the family budget.

loans.use: to buy cattle in order to develop her business

loans.name: Lalyn

texts.en:
This is Lalyn, 50, resident of Araneta, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Antonio and mother to her four children. She, together with her husband, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lalyn operates an auto-repair shop. They have one regular main technician and they have on call workers when needed. They offer repair, check-up, beautification, painting and tinting of all types of cars, jeepneys, and any type of vehicle that is referred to them. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in service fees every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of 45,000 PHP. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare auto parts. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
 
Lalyn hopes to have more supplies of auto parts so that she can improve the service in her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for supplies needed in her auto repair shop.

loans.name: Emedia

texts.en:
Emedia is 51 years old, married and has eleven children. Ten of her children are in school.

Emedia is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Emedia has been farming rice for 31 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Emedia would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 44 years old and a widow with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, noodles, etc.

Rosalie has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from rice farming and pig fattening.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Nongtaaba 3 De Viou Group

texts.fr:
Mme LAMOUSSA est responsable du groupe NONGTAABA 3 DE VIOU. Mariée, elle est mère huit (08) enfants. Le plus âgé a 27 ans et le moins âgé a 11 ans. Les quatre (04) vont à l’école et elle a six (06) personnes en charge.
Elle fait du jardinage depuis plus de 17 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans son secteur.
Mme veut s’acheter une (01) planche d’oignon, une (01) planche de tomate et un (01) sac d’engrais.
Elle veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour la scolarité de ses enfants et répondre à ses besoins. Mme ambitionne agrandir son activité  et mieux entretenir sa famille
texts.en:
Lamoussa is the respresentative of the 'Nongtaaba 3 de Viou' Group.  She is married and has eight children.  The eldest is 27 years old and the youngest is 11 years old.  Four of her children attend school and she is responsible for a total of six people.  Lamoussa has been growing vegetables for more than 17 years.  She buys her supplies locally and will use her loan to buy a quantity of onion seed, a quantity of tomato seed and a sack of fertilizer.

Lamoussa will use her profits to pay for the school fees of her children and provide for her expenses.  In the future, she would like to expand her business and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy a quantity of onion seed, a quantity of tomato seed and a sack of fertilizer for her vegetable growing business.

loans.name: M.akram

texts.en:
M.Akram is a 28-year-old married man, living with his wife and a kid in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

He is a market vendor and delivers eggs to general stores and bakeries; he has many hens for producing eggs to sell. His business is going very well and he is generating enough income for his family. 

Due to the upcoming winter weather, the demand for eggs has  increased. To cope with the demand and for generating maximum profit; he wants to buy more hens for producing more eggs to sell. But due to household expenses, utility bills and miscellaneous expenses, he is unable to buy more hens. 

Therefore, M.Akram has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that he can buy more hens and can get maximum profit in the winter season. 

M.Akram is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy hens for producing eggs for reselling.

loans.name: Djefa

texts.fr: mariée et mère de 4 enfants en charge à 38 ans, Djefa réside à Adidogomé. Elle vend  des condiments. Elle s'approvisionne 2 fois par mois au marché d'assiyéyé. Elle revend par vente ambulante à dans les environs de son quartier et à domicile. Djefa sollicite ce crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et  faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en:
Married with four children to care for at age 38, Djefa resides in Adidogomé. She sells condiments and resupplies twice a month at the Assiyéyé market. She conducts her sales as an itinerant vendor around her neighborhood and from her home.

Djefa is requesting this loan to expand her business, so she can satisfy her customers and make more profit.

loans.use: buy two baskets of fresh tomatoes and one bag of ginger

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen belongs to Taxila, Pakistan. She is 46 years old and a dedicated mother of five children. She is a housewife. Her husband drives a three-wheeled auto rickshaw. It has been eight years that he has been in this business. He is an honest and hardworking person. He drives within the city and provides pickup and drop-off services to the locals. 

He is the sole earner in the family. Their children study at a local government school. Her husband wants to buy a new rickshaw to rent out to get additional income. Therefore, Nasreen has applied for a loan to help her husband buy a new rickshaw. They hope it will help them save money for future purposes.

loans.use: To help her husband buy a new rickshaw

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гулнора 48-летняя жительница района Спитамен. Она вместе с мужем занимается растениеводством. У них один взрослый сын, которому 24 года. Он сейчас находится на заработках в России. Гулнора одновременно последние 5 лет занимается и животноводством. Этой сфере деятельности она научилась у своих родственников. Гулнора берет кредит для купли одного крупнорогатого скота. Сейчас в ее скотном дворе всего одна корова и она хочет удвоить количество скота.
texts.en: Gulnora is a 48-year-old resident of the Spitamen district. She and her husband are involved in agriculture. They have one adult son, who is 24 years old. He is currently working in Russia. Gulnora has been concurrently involved in animal husbandry for the last 5 years. She learned this business from her relatives. Gulnora is requesting this loan to buy one cow. She currently has only one cow in her livestock yard and she wants to double her livestock headcount.

loans.use: to buy another cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medicines and pay for medical visits and tests.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
This is Carmen. She is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy spare parts and accessories and pay for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan for her to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Carmen desires to buy a jeepney for transportation service so that she will have another source of income. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance for her tricycles.

loans.name: Las Comadres  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Las Comadres es un banco comunal está formado por amigas que se han reunido con un objetivo en común que es sacar adelante a sus familias, viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se encuentra bañada por 4 ríos, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo colonial y lo moderno, su gente aún conservan la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.  
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María, tiene 50 años de edad, es madre soltera de 4 hijos de 19, 18, 16 y 14 años, su primer hijo estudia en la universidad y sus tres últimos hijos estudian en el colegio, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive en casa de un familiar.
Doña María es una profesional en la rama de la costura, siempre le gusto esta actividad, tiene un taller en su casa donde realiza todo tipo de arreglos y prendas de vestir, también se dedica a la venta cosméticos, ropa por catalogo y toperware, en su casa también cría  gallinas. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en cosméticos y en la compra de tela. Su meta es de agrandar aun más sus negocios.
texts.en:
The loan group Las Comadres is a communal bank formed by friends that have come together with a common objective, which is to carry their families forward. The live in the city of Cuenca; this city is bathed by 4 rivers, its architecture is a mix of colonial and modern, and its people continue to preserve their culture and traditions.
One of the members of this group is Señora María, who is 50 years old, and a single mother of four children of 19, 18, 16, and 14 years of age. Her eldest studies in college and the other three are in high school; they don't have their own house, so they live with a family member.
Doña María is a professional in the field of sewing, an activity she has always enjoyed. She has a workshop in the house where she makes all types of arrangements and clothing garments. She also sells cosmetics, catalogue clothing and food storage containers, and at her house they raise chickens. She will invest the money from her loan in cosmetics, and to buy fabric. Her goal is to enlarge her business even more.

loans.use: to buy fabric and cosmetics.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en: Gohar is an experienced agronomist from the village of Mrgashat in the Armavir region. Her family consists of her husband and two-year-old daughter. To meet the family’s daily needs, Gohar breeds livestock: calves, pigs, and hens. She is also involved in keeping a grape orchard. Her family members assist her a lot in running the farm. Gohar's husband helps her to sell the agricultural products at the local market. As the needs of the family are growing day by day, they now need to enlarge their livestock a little bit. A loan of US $1500 will be a huge support to this hardworking family and will help them purchase four piglets, forage for feeding the livestock and fertilizer for land cultivation. Gohar and her family will be grateful to the lenders for their good will in helping them to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for four piglets, forage for feeding the livestock and fertilizer for land cultivation.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Agée de 32 ans  Abla est mariée et mère de 3 enfants  résidant à Adidogomé. Elle a commencé son petit commerce en  vendant  du Soja. Elle s'approvisionne 1 fois par mois marché de Noèpé et revend sous un hangar à à domicile.  Abla  sollicite  un crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et  faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en:
32-year-old Abla is married with three children, and lives in Adidogomé. She began her business by selling soybeans. She resupplies once a month at the market in Noèpé and resells under a shed at her home.

Abla is requesting a loan to expand her business, so she can satisfy her customers and make more profit.

loans.use: buy 60 bags of soybeans

loans.name: M.ijaz

texts.en:
M.Ijaz is 40, living in Gujrat, Pakistan. He is religious, sympathetic, honest and a hardworker. He is a farmer by profession and the owner of large areas of land for cultivation. He cultivates seasonal crops on his land and gets fruitful outputs from his crops. Mostly he cultivates wheat crop, rice crop, grams as per season come. Nowadays he is in need of watering for his crops as this year the rainy season was not so effective for the water requirements of the land. For this purpose he has to bear some additional amount. Therefore M.Ijaz has requested a loan from Kiva, field partner of BRAC Pakistan.

He is very thankful to Kiva and its partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the watering cost for his agricultural land.

loans.name: Elda

texts.fr: Elda a 28 ans, mariée et mère  d'un enfant à Adidogomé. Elle fait le petit commerce en vendant des tissus et toiles de couture. Elle s'approvisionne 1 fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé et revend par vente ambulante   dans les environs de son quartier et à domicile. Elda sollicite ce crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en:
Elda is 28 years old, married with one child in Adidogomé. She runs a small business selling cloth and sewing fabrics. She resupplies once a month at the main market in Lomé and resells as an itinerant vendor around her neighborhood and from her home.

Elda is requesting this loan to expand her business and make more profit.

loans.use: buy 24 lengths of fabric

loans.name: Komki 2 Group

texts.fr:
Mme L ODILE est responsable du groupe KOMKI 2. Mariée, elle est mère de cinq (05) enfants. Le plus âgé a 17 ans et le moins âgé a 04 ans. Les trois (03) vont à l’école et elle a sept (07) personnes en charge.
Elle fait la restauration depuis trois (03) ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les communes rurales.
Mme veut s’acheter cinquante (50) plats d’haricots.
Elle veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour payer la scolarité des enfants et les entretenir. Mme ambitionne agrandir son restaurant, collecter les noix de karité et stocker puis revendre.
texts.en:
Odile is the representative of the 'Komki 2' Group.  She is married and has five children.  The eldest is seventeen years old and the youngest is four years old.  Three of her children attend school and she is responsible for a total of seven people.  Odile has been running a restaurant business for three years now.

Odile buys her supplies in the local area and will  use her loan to buy 50 dishes of beans.  Her profits will be used to pay the school fees of her children and provide for their needs.  In the future, she would like to expand her restaurant, and collect and store shea nuts for resale.

loans.use: to buy 50 dishes of beans for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Agée de 37 ans  Yawa est mariée et mère de 2 d'enfants  résidant à Tokoin. Yawaa commencé son petit commerce en  vendant des produits d'alimentation générale. Elle s'approvisionne 4 fois  par mois au grand marché de Lomé et revend dans une boutique au bord de la route de Todman. Yawa sollicite  un crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et  faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en:
37-year-old Yawa is married with two children, and lives in Tokoin. Yawa began her small business by selling general food products. She resupplies four times a month at the main market in Lomé and resells in a shop along the Todman road.

Yawa is requesting a loan to expand her business, so she can satisfy her customers and make more profit.

loans.use: buy two cartons of milk, three boxes of macaroni and four cartons of tomatoes

loans.name: Patognewende Group

texts.fr:
Mme WENDMI est responsable du groupe PATOGNEWENDE. Mariée, elle est mère de neuf (09) enfants. Le plus âgé a 27 ans et le moins âgé a 09 ans. Les trois (03) vont à l’école et elle a sept (07) personnes en charge.
Elle vend des légumes et fait du jardinage depuis 20 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les communes rurales.
Mme veut s’acheter 10 à 12 caisses de tomates.
Elle veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour assurer la scolarité de ses enfants et les besoins de la famille. Elle ambitionne agrandir son jardinage qui comporte la tomate, les oignons.
texts.en:
Wendmi is the representative of the 'Patognewende' Group.  She is married and has nine children.  The eldest is 27 years old and the youngest is nine years old.  Three of her children attend school and she is responsible for a total of seven people.  Wendmi has been growing and selling vegetables for 20 years now.  

Wendmi buys her supplies in the local area and will use her loan to buy 10 to 12 cases of tomatoes.  Her profits will be used to pay for school fees for her children and provide for the needs of her family.  In the future, she would like to expand her vegetable growing which currently includes tomatoes and onions.

loans.use: to buy 10 to 12 cases of tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Mushtaq

texts.en:
Mushtaq is a 25-year-old married man living in the area of Lalamusa, Pakistan. He sells manure in a nearby village, where many farmers are available to offer manure for cultivation. His shop is situated in a poor society and most of his farmers take manure on a credit basis and do not pay back for many days. Now, his credit amount has gone to the limit and he cannot even buy fresh stock to sell.

Mushtaq is a poor person and cannot sustain such kinds of irregularities in payments because manure selling is the only way of generating income for his family. Therefore, Mushtaq has requested a loan so he will be able to buy manure to sell.

This time he will avoid selling manure on a credit basis and he hopes that this loan can easily fulfill the deficiencies.

Mushtaq is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure for reselling

loans.name: Débora

texts.fr: Agée de 28 ans  Débora est mariée  sans enfant  résidant à Adidogomé. Elle a commencé son petit commerce en  vendant  des tissus de pagne traditionnel. Elle s'approvisionne 2 fois par mois au Ghana et revend sous un hangar à domicile.  Débora  sollicite  un crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et  faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en:
28-year-old Débora is married without children, and lives in Adidogomé. She began her small business by selling traditional pagnes (colorful West-African fabric). She resupplies twice a month in Ghana and resells under a shed at her home.

Deborah is requesting a loan to expand her business, so she can satisfy her customers and make more profit.

loans.use: buy one roll of thread

loans.name: Parvana

texts.en: Parvana is 30 years old. She is married and has a three-year-old daughter. Parvana is living with her family in Seyidahmadli village of the Fuzuli region. The family members are IDP’s-Internally Displaced Persons from Fuzuli city. Parvana has been in the sales business and her mother-in-law helps Parvana to take care of and educate the baby. In the store Parvana sells cleaning and personal products. To develop the business she wants to open a food products section, precisely to get more products and stands for the new store's section. For this reason she needs a loan in the amount of 2100 Azerbaijan new manat (AZN). Parvana says, “Thanks dear Kiva lenders for the support. I’m greatly thankful to you.”

loans.use: to buy products and stands to open a food products section.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is married with four children, three of whom go to school.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

She has a market business she has operated for three years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal, bunches of green bananas, cassava, cabbages, tomatoes and onions.  She works at the market six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves.  She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to educate her school-aged children up to university level.   

She resides in the family house where they have access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green banana, cassava, tomatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is a single mother of five children, two of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (elderly parents). She has a business selling charcoal and has been in business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She generates additional income from rental rooms. She works from home seven days a week and sells on both a retail and wholesale basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. 

She aspires to own a delivery van. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of its timely loan. She resides with her family, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a single mother of four children, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of an additional family member: her nephew. She sells fish and has been in this business for 4 years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more baskets of fish. She works from home seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. 

Her major business challenges include the seasonality and scarcity of fish. She hopes to become a wholesaler and also to educate her children up to the university level. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because she wanted additional capital for her fish business. 

She resides in a rented house; the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Ahmadjon

texts.ru: Ахмадчон с детства читал много книг и учился в средней школе успешно. Он в этом году окончил среднюю школу. Для того чтобы продолжить обучение он поступил в университет. Ахмадчон теперь студент первого курса. Он верит в себя, что он окончить университет также успешно, как и среднюю школу. Он должен оплатить за учебный договор и с такой целью он запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Since childhood, Ahmadjon read many books and studied successfully at a secondary school. He graduated from the secondary school this year. To continue his education, he got accepted to a university. Ahmadjon is now a first-year student. He believes in himself and that he will finish the university just as successfully as he did secondary school. He has to pay for his tuition and is requesting a loan in the amount of 1000 US dollars to pay for his tuition. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Agée de 37 ans  Ablavi est mariée et mère de 3 d'enfants  résidant à Nyékonakpoè. Ablavi fait  le petit commerce en  vendant des fruits et des légumes. Elle s'approvisionne 4 fois  par mois au grand marché de Lomé et revend à la devanture de son domicile. Ablavi sollicite  un crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et  faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en:
37-year-old Ablavi is married with three children, and lives in Nyékonakpoé. Ablavi runs a small business selling fruit and vegetables. She resupplies four times a month at the main market in Lomé and resells in front of her home.

Ablavi is requesting a loan to expand her business, so she can satisfy her customers and make more profit.

loans.use: buy 12 bags of potatoes

loans.name: Jisu Shg Group

texts.en:
Jisu Self Help Group consists of nine women from a village in Odisha. They formed this group to help share their problems and to solve their problems themselves. One of the members is Prafulla, who was selected as the president of Jisu Shg. The lady standing with her hand raised in the photo is Prafulla. 

Prafulla is 40 years old and is staying with her husband and her three children. She is involved in growing and selling vegetables in her village. Her husband is supporting her in this activity. 

She along with the group has requested a loan of 135,000 INR and she will use her portion to purchase the required resources for vegetable cultivation. She says her portion of the loan will help her to purchase vegetable seeds, fertilizers and insecticides, and to cover operational expenses like labor charges.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seeds, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en:
Nathan is 35 years old and a resident of Kitemu, a suburb of Wakiso. He is married with six children, four attend school and the other have graduated.

Nathan has a retail shop which he started in 2012, with the aim of acquiring daily income. He wants a loan of 1,200,000 UGX to pay tuition for his children at university. He faces challenges like inadequate capital, competition and changes in demands. His customers are the neighboring shops and people from various towns.

Nathan is such a hard working man with enough capacity to work if he gets enough capital.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Zororo Group

texts.en:
Sipiwe is a member of the Zororo group. After her husband died early this year, her friend encouraged her to join their ROSCA group and she took the advice. They formed the Zororo group and started attending trainings offered at Thrive. The trainings have helped her in that she is now able to manage her finances by preparing a simple budget.
Sipiwe is in the business of tailoring. She also buys and sells maize in rural areas. She started her business 3 years ago. Over the past two years the business was doing very well up until her husband got sick and died as she lost most of her proceeds towards medical bills and the funeral. After the death of her husband, she could not afford to lose heart as she knew that she had two children to look after. Currently, her business needs financing so that she can grow. A loan with Kiva can help Sipiwe to buy more materials for her tailoring business.

loans.use: To expand her tailoring business following the loss of her husband.

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Virgen del Rosario está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Concepción, la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aún se encuentra en crecimiento. 
La Sra.  Adela es una de las integrantes, ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles y las vende allí mismo en su casa. Desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de su trabajo y la ayuda de la fundación vaya mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para hacer sus comidas, como ser verduras, carnes, condimentos y demás. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The group called Virgen del Rosario is in its first cycle of the women's committee programme. It is located in the city of Concepción, an area which is a little far away from the downtown area, and is still growing.
Sra. Adela is one of the members; she makes a living selling food and sells it in her house. She wants to improve her quality of life as time goes by, through her work and the foundation's help. 
She is asking for this loan so that she might invest in buying supplies to make her food, such as vegetables, meats, condiments and more. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meats, condiments and more.

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado 8 de Diciembre está integrado por un número grande de señoras, todas ellas mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, que se encuentran haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza como un medio de crecer.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lidia, quien en su última encuesta mostro un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel  dos , es decir en un nivel medio, donde a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo en la venta de perfumes, podrá ir mejorando su calidad de vida y la de su familia
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de perfumes varios para poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo y luchando por una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The group called 8 de Diciembre is made up of a large number of women; all these women are very hard-working and entrepreneurial, who are currently involved in the poverty elimination survey as a way to grow.
One of the members is Sra. Lidia, who in her latest survey demonstrated a level two level of poverty; that is to say, an intermediate level, in which she might improve her quality of life and that of her family through hard graft and work selling perfumes.
She is asking for this loan to invest in the purchase of various perfumes in order to continue working as she has been, and to continue fighting for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy various perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge está cursando en este año el quinto curso de la carrera de contaduría pública, está trabajando también como asesor de ventas en una empresa importante, está tratando de mejorar cada día su calidad de vida hasta tener otro trabajo acorde a su carrera.
El pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera en contabilidad pública.
Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Jorge is studying the fifth course of the public accounting curriculum this year, as well as working as a sales advisor in an important company. He is trying to improve his quality of life every day until he finds another job commensurate to his career.
He asks this loan to be able to pay the fees of the public accounting curriculum.
