He is thankful for this opportunity that he is receiving and that it will be very much help to him.

loans.use: pay university fees.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en: Khalida lives in Taxila. She is 38 years old. She is married and a mother of four children. Her husband provides public transport with his van. He has been driving this van for over 12 years. He transports people to different locations within Taxila. Due to continuous use, his van is not functioning properly. Because of this, his income is badly affected and faces problems paying for the regular family expenses. Therefore, he wants to repair it. But he lacks money for it as most his income in spent on the household expenses. Khalida has applied for a loan from Brac Pakistan, a Kiva partner. This will help her husband to repair his van.

loans.use: to help her husband repair his van.

loans.name: Lucia Claudina

texts.es:
Lucia tiene 47 años de edad  de estado civil soltera vive con sus 5 hijos en el cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Ella se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para la compra de abono, insecticida, fertilizantes, urea, fungicida. La compra lo realiza en Ventanas. Su meta es aumentar la siembra y comprarse un terreno. Su desafío es las enfermedades en los sembríos. En su tiempo libre le gusta ver la televisión y pasear.
texts.en:
Lucia is 47 years old; she is single and lives with her five children in the Ventenas canton of the los Ríos province. 

She makes a living in farming, sowing corn. She is asking for a loan to buy compost, insecticide, fertilizers, urea, fungicide. She will buy the items in Ventanas. Her aim is to increase sowing and buy herself a piece of land. Her challenge is diseases in the seeds. In her free time she likes to watch television and go for walks.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Anna Rose

texts.en:
Anna Rose lives with her family in Zamboanga del Sur. She has five siblings and is still studying. She is taking computer science. She wants to pursue her studies and have a successful career in the future. She joined GDMPC recently and had borrowed a new loan to pay her school tuition fees for the current school year. 

Anna Rose wants her family to be proud of her.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees for the current school year.

loans.name: Margarita Ester

texts.es:
Margarita de 24 años de edad, estudió hasta octavo grado de educación básica, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, tienen un hijo en común que vive con ellos en casa, con Margarita viven 3 personas pero solo su hijo depende de ella.


Actualmente, Margarita se dedica a los oficios domésticos, pero desea iniciar un negocio de una tienda en su casa ya que está en una ubicación estratégica para vender. Anteriormente ella se dedicaba a vender en una tienda donde le pagaban por su servicio y fue de ahí donde adquirió experiencia. 


Ella necesita el crédito para comprar productos de primera necesidad como azúcar, aceite, frijoles, maíz, entre otros. El préstamo será el inicio de un negocio que vendrá a mejorar los ingresos de su familia y podrá cubrir de mejor manera las necesidades que tiene su hijo.
texts.en:
24 year-old Margarita studied until the eighth grade in basic education. She is joined by her partner and makes a living in farming; they have a son together who lives with them at home. 3 people live with Margarita, but only her son depends on her.

Margarita currently makes a living as a cleaner, but she wants to set up a shop as a business in her house, as she is in a strategic location to sell. She previously made a living as a saleswoman in a shop where they paid her for her services, and where she gained experience.

She needs the loan to buy basic commodities such as sugar, oil, beans, corn, among other things. The loan will be the start of a business which will improve her family's income and will be able to better cover her son's needs.

loans.use: to buy basic commodities such as sugar, oil, beans, corn, among other things.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
Rita es una joven mujer de 20 años de edad, soltera sin hijos y su negocio es el lavado de arena y piedras para construcción.
Ella es emprendedora, luchadora, Inteligente, generosa, fuerte, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona de Chuquiaguillo situado a 4200 metros sobre el nivel del mar dentro de la zona del Altiplano y se encuentra rodeada de altas montañas.
Rita es de tez morena, cabello largo negro, ojos obscuros, su lengua natal es el aymara y utiliza el español para el comercio. Su trabajo consiste en el lavado de arena y piedras para construcción.  El uso y el paso del tiempo ha ido carcomiendo la plancha de su griva de lavado al punto de quedar casi obsoleta y ya no cumple su función con facilidad. Ella necesita renovar su maquinaria para poder trabajar. Su sueño es tener una casa propia.
Es por esos motivos que Rita solicita un préstamo para la compra de una plancha para su griva de lavado y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rita is a 20 year-old young woman; she is single, with no children, and her business is rinsing sand and stones for construction. 
She is entrepreneurial, a fighter, intelligent, generous, strong, responsible and very hard-working. She carries out her business in the Chuquiaguillo area, localed 4200 metres above sea level, in the Altiplano area, where she is surrounded by high mountains.
Rita has a dark complexion, with long black hair, dark eyes; her native language is Aymara and she uses Spanish for business. Her work involves rinsing sand and stones for construction. The use and passage of time has eaten away at the grid of her rinsing machine, to the extent that is is almost obsolete and no longer carries out its function easily. She needs new machinery in order to keep working. Her dream is to have her own house. This is why Rita is asking for a loan to buy a grid for her rinsing machine, and to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a grid for her rinsing machine, and to improve her quality of life.

loans.name: Aylin Group

texts.es:
Aylin es un grupo muy unido, donde todas las integrantes quieren mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia por medio de su trabajo. Una de las integrantes es la señora Antoliana, una mujer muy animada y por sobre todo trabajadora.
Antoliana está luchando por poder dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que no pudo tener, y hoy por medio de su trabajo quiere darles todo. Ella se dedica a la costura, y ya tiene muy buena clientela, que se formó gracias a su trabajo y con mucho esfuerzo.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas e hilos, de manera a seguir cumpliendo con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Aylin is a very connected group, in which the members want to improve their living conditions, and those of their families, through their work. One of the members is Señora Antoliana, a woman who is very lively and, above all, very hardworking.
Antoliana is fighting to be able to give her loved ones everything she could not have, and now through her work she wants to give them everything. She is a seamstress, and now has a very good clientele, that formed thanks to her work and with much strength.
She is asking this loan to buy fabric and thread, so that she may continue her work for her clients.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Alok Shg Group

texts.en:
Gitanjali, a citizen from a rural village located in the Koraput district, is 47 years old and lives with her three children; all of them are dependent on her and two are still in school. For the last 10 years, she has been farming rice and selling vegetables. Her one son supplements their income by working as a laborer in a small factory part time. With the current business, she can earn about 5,000 INR per month and save 2,000 INR per month for future needs. 

Gitanjali is a member of Peoples Forum, which has enabled her to better support her family. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and seeds for her farmland and use some of it to buy more vegetables to sell. She hopes to earn more income from her current business to improve her standard of living and keep her two children in a good school.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers, pesticides, seeds for her farmland and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Jakub Shg Group

texts.en:
Sanjita is a 38-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and two children in a small village in the Koraput district in Odisha, India. Both of her children are attending school. She started a photo studio in a good location in the market in her village with the help of her husband 10 years ago. She earns 7,000 INR per month and has been trying to help her husband financially in managing the family's cash flow. She provides a variety of services like digital passport-size photographs, full sized photographs and video shoots for various auspicious ceremonies like weddings and other functions in the village. She says that showing people beautiful, happy and being part of their happy moments to provide those memories is what she likes the most about her work. She has earned a good name for her studio through her quality work. 

Sanjita has requested a loan to purchase batteries, a tripod, and a camera for her shop. Sanjita, along with her group Jakub Self Help Group, has applied for a loan of 135,000 INR. She has nine members in her group and all are engaged in different kinds of activities.

loans.use: to purchase batteries, a tripod, and a camera for her photo studio.

loans.name: Nilabadi Shg Group

texts.en:
Nine women from a village stepped out and formed a group named Nilabadi Self Help Group in Odisha. They help each other, share their problems and solve them among themselves. They celebrate their festivals together in their village. 

Mamina, the leader of the group, is engaged in the activity of selling products made of plastic like mugs, plates, table covers, Tupperware, containers, etc. She purchases these products from a wholesaler and then sells them at the market. Her husband assists her in selling these products. In this way, she is earning to control her cash flow, which is not sufficient to manage her daily family activities. She wants to enlarge her business, so she wants to purchase more products in bulk, so that she can reduce her transportation cost. In this way, she can earn a good amount after all expenditures in her business. She has requested a loan of 135,000 INR for her group so that they can earn more and control their family's cash flow.

loans.use: to pay for plastic products like mugs, plates, table covers, Tupperware and containers for her business.

loans.name: Mujeres Buscando Un Futuro Group

texts.es:
GLORIA ESTHER, tiene 56 años de edad, tiene una hija de 28 años, estudiante de carrera superior. Gloria Esther forma parte del grupo "Buscando un Futuro" formado por cinco integrantes.
Desde hace muchos años, Gloria Esther inició éste negocio debido a que tenía la obligación de mantener a su pequeña hija sola, su incursión en el negocio inició vendiendo especerías en el mercado, fue juntando un pequeño capital y con ese capital compró algunas prendas de vestir para niños, eligió comprar ropa para niños porque invertiría menos dinero ya que ella no había juntado mucho.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en comprar mas prendas de vestir para niños y cubrir algunos pedidos, seguirá apostando por éste negocio ya que le ha ido bien y le ha brindado un estabilidad económica, ya que ella es el apoyo de su hija, quien está estudiando para ser profesional.
texts.en:
Gloria Esther, 56 years old, has a 28-year-old daughter, who is a student of superior quality. Gloria Esther is part of the group "Buscando un Futuro" (Seeking a Future) composed of 5 members.
For many years, Gloria Esther created this business due to her obligation to take care of her small daughter by herself. Her foray into business started by selling spices in the market; she gathered a small capital, and with this capital purchased some clothing garments for children. She chose to buy children's clothing because she could invest less money since she had not yet saved much.
The received loan will be invested to buy more clothing garments for children and cover some orders; she will continue to bet on this business since it has gone well and has provided her an established income. She is the support for her daughter, who is studying to be a professional.

loans.use: to buy clothing garments for children.

loans.name: Najma* Group

texts.en:
This group is called Najma*. It consists of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 175,000 YER from AMB.

Najma is the leader of the group. She is a 47-year-old married woman with six children. Her oldest child is 27 years old and the youngest one is 2 years old. They live in their own house in the capital city of Sana'a. She is an uneducated but very active and dynamic woman. Due to the miserable conditions of her parents, Najma was deprived of going to school. After she got married, her husband was the sole breadwinner of the family. Over time, he became unable to look after his family. Najma wanted to help him with that responsibility. She has a great determination to make a real change inside her family. Najma decided to work selling clothes, accessories and makeup door-to-door. She started this business many years ago. Najma found this business was good for her. In order to expand her business, Najma asked for a loan of 25,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more of the stylish ready-made women and children's clothes and many kinds of accessories and makeup to resell.

Najma looks forward to expanding her business by opening a large shop to sell all of the stylish clothes and cosmetics to make a better future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase women and children's clothes,  accessories and makeup to sell

loans.name: Specioza

texts.en:
Specioza is married with six children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She lives in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

She has a poultry farming business which she has been in for over 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of poultry feed, vaccines and chicks. She generates additional income from rental houses. She works seven days a week and sells on both a retail and wholesale basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She aspires to build more poultry houses. 

She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of the timely loans.

loans.use: To buy bags of poultry feed, vaccines and serving utensils

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with five children. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and food. She operates a retail shop at the market. She has been in business for the last 11 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 500,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy boxes of soap, sugar, cooking oil, flour, and rice. Her major business challenges are transportation, the ever-increasing price of commodities and unreliable electricity. Her goals are to become a wholesaler and to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy soap, cooking oil, sugar, flour and soda

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca lives in Suai and most of her daily income is from selling chickens. She is now applying for a loan of $800. She will use the loan to buy other chickens to bring to the market to sell. Francisca started to do her business in 2012 with her own working capital of $500. With the loan offered from Tuba Rai Metin, she will have more working capital to buy more chickens. She was happy after she got the loan from Tuba Rai Metin because with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she will improve her business in the future. She also has animals like buffalos, cows and pigs.

loans.use: To buy more chickens.

loans.name: Neil

texts.en: Neil has two siblings. His mother is selling banana cue in their village while his father works as a carpenter. As the only son in the family, he wants to augment his family's living. He is studying for his Associate in Electrical Technology and wants to become a professional electrician in the future. He joined GDMPC recently and borrowed a new loan to pay his school tuition fees for this current school year.

loans.use: to pay his school tuition fees

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Hello Kiva lenders, meet Martin a dedicated and passionate farmer from Makutano, a remote village in Thika. For the past six years, he has been taking care of his lovely wife and one child by selling crops and milk. He also engages in transportation services and with his motorbike, he makes some extra income transporting his neighbors and their farm produce. One of the best activities that Martin enjoys doing is crop farming and he is determined to expand his farming activities, though his biggest challenge remains poor productivity. 

Martin is seeking a loan from Kiva through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase farm implements. Small-scale farmers like Martin cannot get formal financing from banks because of the irregular income and lack of collateral. But with Juhudi Kilimo, it’s a different ball game. They see potential in farmers that not every organization can see. Through the loan, he will buy good quality fertilizer and good seeds that will boost his productivity. An increase in productivity will result in increased income and increased profit margins. The loan will allow permanent change in Martin's life and he will be able to improve his living conditions. Martin's dream is to secure the future of his child and wife.

loans.use: To purchase farm implements

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 35 years old and a resident of Ntinda, a suburb of Wakiso. He is married with three children and all attend school. 

David has a taxi transport business which he started in 2006 with the aim of increasing his daily income. It has been successful up to now since it is in a busy centre. 

David is a first time borrower who needs a loan of 4,000,000 UGX to buy some spare parts for his taxi to keep it in good condition. He faces the usual challenges of competition in the transport business.

David is very committed, and his hope is to have more vehicles one day and to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Siempre Unidas De Smp Group

texts.es:
Guadalupe, tiene 39 años de edad, tiene dos hijos uno de 16 y otro de 7 años. Vive con su pareja quien es su apoyo económico y emocional.
Hace catorce años inició éste negocio, de ser solo ama de casa, tuvo que buscar la forma de generar un ingreso económico extra en su familia, así que aprendió e inició el negocio de reparación de equipos celulares, poco a poco fue juntando un pequeño capital para poder invertirlo en la compra de equipos celulares y en accesorios. Su puesto está ubicado en un mercado ahí ella atiende a su clientela quienes ya la buscan por el buen servicio que brinda y sus clientes la recomiendan.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de equipos especiales para la reparación de los equipos celulares modernos, de última generación.
texts.en:
Guadalupe, 39 years old, has two sons: one is 16, and the other is 7. She lives with her partner who is her financial and emotional support. She started her business 14 years ago; being just a housewife, she had to find a way to generate extra income for her family, so she learned and started a business of cell phone equipment repair. Little by little she saved a small capital to be able to buy cellular equipment and accessories. Her station is located in a market; there she serves her customers who now seek her out for the good service she provides, and from client recommendations.
She will invest the received loan to buy special equipment to repair modern cellular equipment, of the most recent generation.

loans.use: to buy equipment to repair cell phones and accessories.

loans.name: Padaeteng

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de 6 enfants,  Padaeteng   est âgée de 51 ans et réside à Agoé. Elle est revendeuse de boisson locales qu'elle prépare elle meme à base de mil. Fafavi  s’approvisionne deux(02) fois par mois au marché d’Asiyéyé et revend dans le même marché. Padaeteng  sollicite un prêt pour augmenter son stock dans le but de répondre aux besoins de ses clients et augmenter son bénéfice.
texts.en: 51-year-old Padaeteng is a married mother to six children who lives in Agoe. She sells local alcoholic beverages which she herself produces from millet. She gets her supplies from the market in Asiyéyé twice monthly and she sells her produce at the same market. Padaeteng is requesting a loan in order to increase her stock so that she can better meet the demand from her customers and also increase her earnings.

loans.use: to purchase 110 bowls of millet

loans.name: Patricia Liliana

texts.es: Liliana es madre soltera, ella vive con su hija de un año, sus padres, hermanas y sobrinas, Liliana se dedica al jornal, a la crianza de animales menores y los fines de semana trabaja de mesera en un restaurante, el crédito la va a utilizar comprando chanchos para mejorar su negocio y por ende sus ingresos, esta mujer trabajadora aspira trabajar lo más duro posible para juntar dinero y algún día comprarse su casa para mejorar la calidad de vida de su hija.
texts.en:
Patricia Liliana is a single mother who lives with her one-year-old daughter, her parents, sisters and nieces. She is a daily-paid worker who rears small animals, and on weekends she works as a waitress in a restaurant.

Patricia Lilliana is going to use this loan to buy pigs to improve her business and thereby her income. She is a hard-working woman who aspires to work as hard as she can to get enough money and one day to buy her own house in order to improve her daughter's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Kagnité

texts.fr:
Agée de 25 ans,  Kagnité est mariée et mère d'un enfant à Agoè. Elle fait du commerce en vendant des pagnes par la vente ambulante dans les quartiers. Elle s’approvisionne une fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé.
 Kagnité sollicite un prêt pour appuyer son activité afin de satisfaire les besoins des clients et faire plus de profits et prendre soin de ces enfants.
texts.en: 25-year-old Kagnité is a married mother to one child who lives in Agoe. She makes a living selling pagne cloth as a street vendor. She gets her supplies once per month from the large market in Lomé. Kagnité is requesting a loan to support her business so that she can satisfy her customers' needs and earn a larger profit so she can take care of her child.

loans.use: to purchase six sheets of pagne cloth

loans.name: Esssohanam

texts.fr: Mariée âgée de 46 ans, Esssohanam a deux(2) enfants en charge et habite le quartier d'Agoè. Elle revend les charbon de bois  qu’elle achète chez un grossiste qui vient livrer à la maison deux  fois par mois. Esssohanam revend par la vente ambulante dans les environs de son quartier de résidence. Esssohanam sollicite un prêt pour augmenter son commerce afin de satisfaire les clients et faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en: 46-year-old Esssohanam lives with two children under her care in Agoe. She sells wood charcoal, which she purchases from a wholesaler who delivers to her home twice every month. Esssohanam sells this charcoal as a street vendor throughout the surrounding local area. Esssohanam is requesting a loan to grow her business so that she can satisfy her customers and bring in a larger profit.

loans.use: to purchase 15 sacks of wood charcoal

loans.name: Dorila

texts.es:
Dorila es una mujer que siempre ha salido adelante, tiene 59 años de edad y vive en San Martin junto a su familia. Tiene dos maravillosos hijos y un esposo que la apoya de manera incondicional y por quienes siempre ha luchado en la vida para poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Desde hace más de 3 años se dedica al negocio de la panadería y le va muy bien porque siempre ofrece productos de calidad y es muy amable con los clientes. Gracias a esto Dorila pudo brindar una educación de calidad a sus hijos quienes hoy se han convertido en personas de bien.
Dorila está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque gracias al apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá cambiar la cerca de su casa, de esta manera tendrá mayor seguridad y su familia podrá vivir de manera más cómoda. Más adelante quiere mejorar su negocio para poder tener mayores ingresos y seguir elevando el nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Dorila is a woman that has always moved forward; she is 59 years old and lives in San Martin with her family. She has two marvelous sons and a spouse that supports her unconditionally, and for them, she has always fought to improve their quality of life. For over three years she has been in the bakery business, and it works well because she always offers quality products, and is very friendly with the customers. Thanks to this, Dorila was able to provide a quality education to her children, who today have become good people.
Dorila is very grateful for the Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they have provided she is able to change the fence at her house, which means she will have better security and her family can live in a more comfortable manner. In the future she wants to improve her business to be able to have a better income and continue elevating the level of life for her family.

loans.use: to change the fence of her house.

loans.name: Kiswendsida Sugre N Manegde Group

texts.fr:
Mme AMINATA est responsable du groupe KISWENDSIDA SUGRE N MANEGDE. Mariée, elle est mère de cinq (05) enfants. Le plus âgé a 30 ans et le moins âgé a 15 ans.  04 vont à l’école et elle a 02 personnes en charge.
Elle fait le jardinage et vend du céréale depuis plus de 40ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans son village.
Mme veut s’acheter 01planche d’oignon, 01planche de tomate et 01 sac d’engrais pour son jardin.
Elle veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour  la scolarité des enfants et l’entretien de la famille. Mme ambitionne agrandir son activité en comptant toujours sur Micro Start et partenaire.
texts.en:
Aminata is the representative for the 'Kiswendsida Sugre N Manegde' Group.  She is married and has five children.  The eldest child is 30 years old, and the youngest is 15 years old.  Four of her children attend school and she is responsible for a total of two people.

Aminata has been growing vegetables and selling cereals for more than 40 years now.  She buys her supplies in her village, and plans to use her loan to buy one strip of onion seeds, one strip of tomato seeds and one sack of fertilizer for her garden.  Her profits will be used to pay for school fees for her children and provide for the needs of her family.  In the future, she would like to expand her business and plans to rely on the help of the field partner, Micro Start.

loans.use: to buy one strip of onion seeds, one strip of tomato seeds and one sack of fertilizer for her garden.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael tiene 76 años de edad, no asistió a la escuela debido a que en su época no había acceso a la educación en la zona donde él vivía, está acompañado y es su segunda relación matrimonial, ya que su pareja anterior falleció con quien tuvo los hijos mayores, su pareja actual se dedica a una pequeña tienda que tienen en el hogar, sus hijos menores viven en casa y estudian en la escuela.  

Él está jubilado, trabajó durante 25 años en una institución hidroeléctrica, por lo que ya cumplió el tiempo de trabajo según la ley, se desempeñaba como motorista de transporte pesado, trabajo que aprendió por medio de un amigo quien le ayudó a ingresar a la institución, también fue vendedor de leche, ahora solo permanece en casa ayudando a su esposa en la tienda. 

Rafael necesita el crédito para comprar mercadería para su tienda, como aceite, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, bebida etc.

Sus sueños son seguir educando a sus hijos menores y apoyarlos en el estudio mientras pueda.
texts.en:
Rafael is 76 years old. He could not study because there were no schools where he lived when he was of school age. His first wife died and he got married again. His wife runs a grocery store at home. Rafael has children from both relationships; the youngest ones live with him and go to school.

Rafael is now a retired person. He worked for twenty-five years for a hydropower station, before reaching the legal age for retiring. He worked as a truck driver, an activity he learned from a friend who helped him to get a job in this company. He also used to sell milk, but now stays at home and helps his wife with the store.

Rafael is requesting a loan to buy supplies for the store, such as vegetable oil, beans, rice, sugar and beverages. His dream is to continue helping his youngest children with their studies as long as he can.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his store, such as vegetable oil, beans, rice, sugar and beverages.

loans.name: Wendyalgdo Group

texts.fr:
Mr  HAMIDOU  représente le  groupe WENDYALGDO. SALIFOU se porte bien mais HAMIDOU le remplace. Marié, Il est père de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 13ans et le moins âgé a 03ans. 02 vont  à l’école.
Mr  vend des sacs depuis 05 ans.  Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés en ville. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.
Il veut s’acheter  01 douzaine de sacs, 03 douzaines de sacs d’écoliers.
Il  veut épargner  ses bénéfices. Mr ambitionne agrandir son champs d’activité et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Hamidou is the representative of the Wendyalgdo Group.  Salifou is doing well but has been replaced by Hamidou.  Hamidou is married and has three children.  The eldest is thirteen years old and the youngest is three years old.  Two of his children currently attend school.

Hamidou has been selling bags for five years.  He buys his supplies at the markets in his town, and sells them to both men and women.

He plans to use his loan to buy one dozen bags and three dozen school bags for resale.  His profits will be saved.  In the future, Hamidou would like to expand his field of business and be able to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy one dozen bags and three dozen school bags for resale.

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y su esposo se dedica al comercio, tiene 8 hijos los cuales 5 están en la escuela y los otros tres en hogares aparte.

Rosa se dedica al comercio, y lo aprendió de su esposo, comenzó vendiendo aguacates, después otro tipo de mercadería y vio que le generaba buenos ingresos, el lugar donde trabaja está a 40 minutos y viaja en carro de su esposo.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar más frutas, como jocotes y anonas, también comprará verduras como papas, tomates.

Sus sueños son seguir trabajando para darles el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 47 years old and married. Her husband is a businessman. She has eight children: five go to school and three have their own families.

Rosa is a businesswoman. She learned this activity from her husband. She started selling avocados, but after a while she started selling more things and realized that she was making good profits. Her workplace is located 40 minutes away from home, so her husband takes her there in his car.

Rosa is requesting a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables, like jocote [a type of plum native to the Americas], cherimoya, potatoes and tomatoes.

Her dream is to continue working in order to be able to pay for her children’s studies.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell, such as jocotes, cherimoyas, potatoes and tomatoes.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr:
Jeanne est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dans le quartier d’Agoé. Elle est âgée de 37 ans et exerce comme activité la vente de pâte bandé fait à base du maïs. Elle s’approvisionne Trois fois par mois au marché d’Akodessewa  pour  l’achat  des céréales ,et après préparation elle revend à la devanture de son domicile.
Jeanne  sollicite un prêt pour faire plus de stock afin de faire des bénéfices considérables.
texts.en:
Jeanne is 37 years old, married and has five children.  She lives in the Agoé neighbourhood and sells maize dough.  She buys her supplies of cereals three times a month at the market in Akodessewa.  Once she has prepared the maize dough, she sells it from the front of her home.

Jeanne has requested this loan to build up her stock levels and considerably increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy 80 bowls of maize for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr: Agée de 34 ans, Adjovi est mariée et mère de deux(2) enfants à Agoè. Elle est coiffeuse de formation et elle fait du commerce en vendant des produits dans une boutique de son quartier. Elle s’approvisionne une fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé.Adjovi sollicite un prêt pour appuyer son activité afin de satisfaire les besoins des clients et faire plus de profits et prendre soin de ces enfants.
texts.en:
Adjovi is 34 years old, married and mother to two children.  She lives in Agoè.  Originally she trained as a hairdresser and now sells beauty products from her shop in the local area.  She buys her supplies once a month from the main market in Lomé.

Adjovi has requested this loan in order to strengthen her business and satisfy the desires of her customers.  In this way she will make larger profits and be able to provide for her children.

loans.use: to buy 30 hair extensions, 16 hair braids and other beauty products for resale.

loans.name: Abizera Group

texts.fr:
Acqueline fait partie du groupe Abizera  et  habite à Gitega. Elle  a  36  ans et est mariée à Deo. Un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 7 mois   à  13 ans, dont 4  étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce de  téléphones portables et leurs accessoires   depuis 3 ans. 

Elle est à  son sixième   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de téléphones portables   à revendre  pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Acqueline is a member of the Abizera Group, and lives in Gitega.  She is 36 years old and married to Deo who is a retailer.  Together they have five children between seven months and thirteen years old.  Four of their children currently attend school.

Acqueline has been selling portable telephones and their accessories for three years.  This will be her sixth loan from the field partner, Turame.  She plans to use her loan to increase her working capital and buy many portable telephones for resale.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and buy many mobile telephones for resale.

loans.name: Martha Maria

texts.es:
Martha tiene 40 años de edad de estado civil soltera vive con sus 3 hijos en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Ella es una comerciante de granos y engorda cerdos. Solicita el crédito para la compra de granos secos para incrementar el negocio. La compra lo realiza en Ventanas. Su meta es mejorar su negocio y comprarse un terreno. En su tiempo libre le gusta escuchar música y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Martha is 40 years old and single. She lives with her three children in the canton of Ventanas, province of Los Rios. 

She works as grain merchant and fattening pigs. She is requesting the loan to buy dry grains to increase the business. She does the purchasing in Ventanas. 

Her goal is to improve her business and buy a piece of land. In her free time she likes to listen to music and play sports.

loans.use: to buy dry grains.

loans.name: Fidel Neftali

texts.es:
Fidel de 20 años de edad.  A su corta edad es una persona que ha estudiado hasta el tercer año de bachillerato opción Técnico Agropecuario.

Fidel vive con su madre, una mujer esmerada que ha luchado por su hijo desde que nació; Fidel desde que termino de cursar su educación media se dedicó a ejercer su propio negocio.

Él se dedica a la crianza de pollos de engorde, trabajo en el cual ya tiene 2 años de ejercerlo,  él lo aprendió en el estudio que obtuvo en el complejo de la comunidad. Fidel necesita el efectivo del crédito para comprar alimentos (concentrados) para sus pollos. Además, comprara una maya para arreglar la cerca de sus aves.

A futuro Fidel se ve como un gran empresario de su comunidad, es un negocio rentable y lo mejor de todo es algo que a él le gusta. Desea darle lo mejor a su madre que es quien ha luchado muy arduamente junto con él para obtener sus triunfos.
texts.en:
Fidel, at the young age of just 20, has studied a third-year secondary course in Technical Agriculture and Livestock. He lives with his mother, a conscientious woman who has fought for her son since his birth. Fidel has had his own business since he completed his middle-school studies. He works raising chickens for fattening, a job he has done for 2 years now. He learnt this in a class provided at a community centre.

Fidel needs a loan to buy concentrated animal feed for his chickens. He will also buy wire-mesh to fix his bird fence. He sees himself in the future becoming an admirable entrepreneur within his community. He has a profitable business and, above all, it's something he enjoys. He wants to provide the best for his mother, who is someone who has struggled a lot for him to be successful.

loans.use: to buy concentrated animal feed for his chickens and wire-mesh to mend the fence for his birds.

loans.name: Manuel Trinidad

texts.es:
Manuel de 42 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato y luego ingresó a la academia de la policía logrando concluir sus estudios, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen tres hijos entre 11 y 17 años de edad que se encuentran estudiando distintos niveles académicos. 


Manuel es empleado es público, se desempeña como agente de seguridad, ya tiene 8 años de trabajar en la institución, desde pequeño soñaba con ser seguridad, además se dedica a la agricultura en los tiempos que tiene libre. Él trabaja 5 días y descansa otros 5, su horario es de 6:00 am a 5:00 pm.
  
El préstamo lo necesita para cubrir una deuda adquirida en una institución financiera, debido a que tuvo gastos de salud en una hija que estaba enferma, y ahora debe pagar esa deuda.

Sus sueños a futuro son ser aplicado siempre en su trabajo y con esto logra subir de rango, también llevar el sustento a su hogar y apoyar a sus hijos a que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Manuel is 42. He studied up to degree level and then enrolled in a police academy, where he managed to complete his studies. He is in a long-term relationship and his partner takes care of the domestic tasks. They have three children aged between 11 and 17 who are studying at various academic levels.

Manuel is a public employee who works as a security officer. He has been working at his institution for 8 years. He has dreamed of working in security since he was a small boy. He also works in agriculture in his spare time. He works for 5 days and takes a break for 5. His daily timetable is from 6 am until 5 pm.

He needs the loan to cover a debt acquired through a financial institution, as he had health costs relating to his sick daughter, and he now has to pay this debt back. His dreams for the future are to have constant work and through this gain promotion and be able to support his family and help his children to become professionals.

loans.use: to cover a debt acquired through a financial institution relating to health costs for his sick daughter.

loans.name: Vicente Arturo

texts.es:
Vicente tiene 41 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive con sus 4 hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
El se dedica a la agricultura a la siembre de arroz. Solicita el crédito para la compra de abonos, fertilizantes e insecticidas. La compra lo realiza en Ventanas. Su meta es incrementar su negocio y comprarse un terreno . Su desafío es las enfermedades en los cultivos. En su tiempo libre le gusta salir de paseo y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Vicente is 41 years old and single. He lives with his four children in the canton of Ventanas, province of Los Rios.

He works in agriculture planting rice. He is requesting the loan to buy manure, fertilizers and insecticides. He does the purchasing in Ventanas.

His goal is to improve his business and buy a piece of land. His challenge is crop disease. In his free time he likes to go out and play sports.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Anushavan

texts.en:
This young man is 24 years old and he lives with his nice family in the village of Geghi in the Syunik region. Anushavan has no higher education and after returning from the army he became a perfect farmer. In his farm Anushavan has 4 cows, 2 bulls and 2 calves. He is happy with his farming occupation, which allows him to sell a great range of farm products such as meat, milk, macun (an Armenian national dairy product), cheese, butter and curd. He sells all these at the city wholesale market. Anushavan’s wife helps him greatly and despite her young age perfectly makes cheese and curds. This is Anushavan’s first loan and he has great hope that it will be profitable for his farm and his young family. He hopes that he will appear among those farmers who by the help of loan receive a chance of better living condition, develop farming and finally have financial stability. 

Anushavan needs this loan to purchase hay for his farm cattle since it is time when farmers store the hay by drying it for the coming cold and damp season.

loans.use: to buy hay for his farm cattle

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit has been involved in the retail business for 7 years. Specifically, she sells shoes in a rented store in Armavir town. To be able to cover her customers' demand, Anahit needs more funds for her retail business. She has requested this loan of 3000 USD to be able to purchase a new stock of shoes for her store. 

She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Anahit hopes that lenders' will support her small business to develop further and asks for their goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for a new stock of shoes for her store

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en: Mary Grace is studying to earn a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration. She has one sibling and she lives with her family. Her parents earn money from farming and she often helps them in their work. She joined GDMPC and borrowed a new loan to pay her tuition fees for the first semester of this current school year. She wants to become successful in the future.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees for the first semester of this current school year

loans.name: María Juana

texts.es:
María de 54 años, estudió hasta tercer grado, ahora está casada y su esposo se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, tienen hijos pero ninguno depende de ellos solo un nieto. 

María se dedica a la elaboración de tortillas y lo ha hecho desde hace 10 años aproximadamente.

Ella necesita el crédito para invertir en la agricultura, comprará abono, fertilizantes, venenos y otros que sirven para el proceso de desarrollo de la  misma. 

Sueña con darle estudios a su nieto para que algún día pueda ser un profesional.
texts.en:
Maria is 54 years old. She studied up to third grade. She is now married and her husband works in agriculture. They have children but none of them dependents, only a grandson.

Maria makes tortillas and she has done this for approximately 10 years. She needs the loan to invest in agriculture, she will buy manure, fertilizers, pesticides and other inputs needed to develop farming.

She dreams to give schooling to her grandson so that he may one day become a professional.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Pedro Amilcar

texts.es:
Pedro de 47 años de edad, es jornalero y estudió hasta séptimo grado, no pudo continuar sus estudios por la economía en que vivían sus padres, esta acompañado y es padre de 6 hijos de 22, 20, 17, 16, 12 y 10 años de edad, de los cuales 4 se encuentran estudiando y son lo que dependen de él y dos se dedican a trabajar. Su compañera de vida trabaja como rosando caña, mientras que Pedro trabaja como jardinero desde hace 12 años trabajo que lo aprendió de un amigo, decidió dedicarse a esto por la necesidad económica. 

Para trasladarse a su trabajo Pedro viaja en bicicleta 2 kilómetros, trabajando en el horario de 7:00 am a 4:00 pm todos los días.

El prestamos que esta solicitando Pedro en la institución de CREDICAMPO, es para comprar materiales para construcción como lamina, madera etc., para poder ampliar mas su vivienda y así darle un poco mas de comodidad a su familia ya que la casita donde vive es muy pequeña.

El sueño de Pedro, es poder darles estudios a sus hijos hasta que sean unos jóvenes profesionales y puedan tener un buen trabajo para que puedan seguir a delante y comprar una motocicleta para trasladarse a su trabajo.
texts.en:
Pedro is 47 years old and a farm labourer. He has a seventh grade education but could not continue with school due to his parents' financial situation. Pedro has a partner, and is a father to six children, who are 22, 22, 17, 16, 12 and 10 years old. Four of Pedro's children are in full-time education and depend on their father; two are working. Pedro's life partner looks after reeds for a living, while Pedro himself has been a gardener for 12 years. He learned his trade from a friend and decided to make this his living as he needed to earn money.

Pedro must cycle two kilometres in order to arrive at work. He works every day from 7am until 4pm.

Pedro is applying for a loan from CrediCampo and will use it to buy building materials, such as metal sheeting and wood, in order to build an extension on his home. This will make his family a little more comfortable as the house where they live is very small.

Pedro's dream is to give his children enough education so that they may have a profession, have a good job and move forward in life. He also wants to buy a motorcycle for travelling to work.

loans.use: to buy building materials, such as metal sheeting and wood, in order to build an extension on his home.

loans.name: Henry Jair

texts.es:
Henry de 25 años de edad, es pescador artesanal, estudió hasta el 7° grado, por la economía no pudo continuar sus estudios. Es un hombre soltero pero tiene una niña de 6 años de edad, la cual se encuentra estudiando y depende de él, Henry vive con su hija, sus padres y hermanos.

Henry se dedica a la pesca artesanal desde que era niño, también se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y por veces trabaja como lanchero trabajo que lo aprendió de su padre quien siempre se ha dedicado a esto, Henry para llegar a su trabajo viaja en motocicleta un kilometro, trabajando en el horario de 7:00 am a 5:00 pm.

El préstamo que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO, es para la compra de cerdos de engorde, así podrá venderlos en un tiempo donde espera poder obtener un ingreso mejor para darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

El sueño de Henry es comprar un vehículo para comerciar sus cerdos y darle estudio a su hija hasta que sean una profesional para que en el futuro sea una persona de bien.
texts.en:
Henry is 25 years old and an artisan fisherman. He has a seventh grade education but, due to his parents' financial situation, could not continue with school. Henry is single but has a six-year-old daughter, who is in school and depends on her father. Henry lives with his daughter, his parents, and his siblings.

Henry has been working as an artisan fisherman since he was a boy. He also raises pigs and sometimes works as a boatman, a trade he learned from his father who spent his life working in this field. Henry must travel one kilometre by motorbike to arrive at his work. He works from 7am until 5pm.

This loan from CrediCampo will be used to buy pigs to fatten up. He will sell the pigs after some time and will hopefully earn a higher income in order to provide his family with a higher quality of life.

Henry's dream is to buy a vehicle to use when selling his pigs. He also wants to give his daughter an education so that she may have a profession and be a useful member of society.

loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten up.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo de 66 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto grado, está casado y su esposa le ayuda en el molino que tiene en su casa,  ninguno de sus hijos dependen de él. 

Pablo tiene un molino con el cual ofrece servicios a la comunidad, además posee ganado y trabaja en la agricultura desde temprana edad.

Él necesita el crédito para comprar ganado e invertir en sus trabajos agrícolas, como comprar abono, fertilizantes entre otros. 

Sus planes son comprar más ganado para poder dejarle a su familia un capital con el cual puedan seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Pablo is 66 years old and has a fifth grade education. He is married; his wife helps to work the grinder in the family home. None of Pablo's children is still dependent on him.

Pablo has a grinder that he uses to offer grinding services to the community. He also raises cattle and has worked in farming since a young age.

Pablo needs this loan in order to buy cattle and invest in his farming work by buying manure, fertilisers and other goods.

Pablo plans to buy more cattle in order to leave his family enough capital so as to be able to continue working.

loans.use: to buy cattle and invest in his farming work by buying manure, fertilisers and other goods.

loans.name: Karla

texts.es:
Karla
Poas, Carrillos, Costa Rica

La clienta tiene 30 años de edad, vive con su compañero. Tiene 3 hijos, los dos mayores estudian en la escuela y el menor tiene 1 año. La mama la ha motivado para que inicie su pequeño negocio de venta de artículos por medio de catálogo, además de sandalias provenientes de Nicaragua. Karla es una  mujer con deseos de superación y quiere brindarle a sus 2 hijos mayores la oportunidad de estudiar. Con su pareja actual tiene una hija pequeña, desea crecer y apoyar a su familia. Mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos, es su prioridad. 
Esta actividad la  inicia con el apoyo de su mamá y hermana, una vez que ha tenido una clientela estable decide solicitar el crédito para aumentar su capital de trabajo y cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes.

 Actividad pequeña, de venta ambulante de catálogos y sandalias de moda, Busca el apoyo en Fundación Mujer para aumentar su capital e ir creciendo en el negocio.
texts.en:
Karla
Poas, Carrillos, Costa Rica

This borrow is 30 years old and lives with her partner. She has three children; the eldest two are in school while the youngest is only one year old. Karla's mother motivated her to start a small business selling catalogue goods. She also sells sandals imported from Nicaragua. Karla wants to do better in life and wants to give her two eldest children the opportunity to study. Karla has a young daughter with her current partner. She wants to expand her family, and support them. She wants to give her family a better quality of life. Her children are her greatest priority.

Karla started this business with the support of her mother and sister. Now that she has a stable customers base, she has decided to apply for a loan in order to increase her working capital and cover customer orders.

A small business selling catalogue items and fashionable sandals as a street vendor, Karla is looking for support from Fundación Mujer in order to increase her capital and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes and sandals.

loans.name: Santos Digna

texts.es:
Santos de 54 años de edad, es viuda pues su esposo falleció hace unos años, ella no estudió ya que en la zona donde  vivía no habían escuelas y también su familia era de bajos recursos económicos, tiene cuatro hijos de los cuales dos estudian y dependen de ella.

Santos se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace más de cinco años, este negocio lo aprendió de su madre, solamente esta actividad realiza, el negocio lo tiene en el lugar de su residencia, ella trabaja todos los días y sus hijos mayores le ayudan en la actividad. 

Ella necesita el crédito para mejorar un terreno que tiene, con ayuda de sus hijos ha logrado comprarlo ya que donde vive actualmente es alquilado.

Uno de sus sueños es tener su propia casa y que sus hijos estudien ya que ella no tuvo esa oportunidad.
texts.en:
Santos is a 54-year-old widow whose husband passed away a few years ago. She didn't go to school because there were no schools where she lived and because her family was poor. She has four children, two of whom attend school and are dependent on her. She has worked selling tortillas for over five years. She learned this business from her mother. She only has this job, which she does from her home. She works every day and her grown-up children help her with this.

Santos needs a loan to improve some land she owns that she managed to buy with the help of her children, because where she currently lives is rented. One of her dreams is to own her own house and for her children to go to school, as she herself didn't have that opportunity.

loans.use: to improve a plot of land that she managed to buy with the help of her children, since where she currently lives is rented.

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en: Aziz is a married man selling motorcycle spare parts and operating a garage in Kagadi, Uganda, to earn money for a living. He hopes to grow his business and increase his income. Aziz is hard working, despite the hardship of high competition in the market. He is asking for a loan to buy motorcycle spare parts to meet the high demand.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 30 years old and a resident of Rubaga, a suburb of Kampala. She has 3 children, who attend school.

Josephine works in a retail shop that she started in 2010 with the aim of improving her daily income that would cater to her family's needs. The shop is located in a trading center, and Josephine’s main customers are neighbors and people from different areas. She is assured of a strong market and has all the experience to succeed in this business. However, she faces some challenges, such as competition, inadequate capital and, at times, weather changes that affect the market.

Josephine needs to obtain a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to purchase more stock for her business to meet the needs of her customers. Josephine’s dream is to become a big trader through acquiring more loans as a simple source of income for her.

loans.use: buy corn flour, rice, sugar, soap, beans and other items

loans.name: Jelyn

texts.en:
Jelyn believes that the path to success is traveled by those who believe in themselves.

She has two siblings and lives with her family. She is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration and wants to have a better job in her future. She joined GDMPC recently to request a loan to pay her school tuition fees for this current semester.

She wants to improve her general living situation and to support her parents in the near future.

loans.use: to pay her school tuition fees for this current semester.

loans.name: Wilberforce

texts.en: Wilberforce sells produce and practices farming in Kagadi, Uganda. He is a married man and plans to improve his business to earn more money and improve his general welfare. Wilberforce is hard working but challenged by weather changes and the poor roads that interfere with his service delivery. He intends to use the loan to buy ground nuts and maize for selling.

loans.use: to buy ground nuts and maize for selling

loans.name: Oliva

texts.en:
Oliva has dealt in fresh foods and selling general merchandise since 2006.  She lives in Kagadi, Uganda and is married with 5 children.  Despite her honesty and hard work, she has limited capital and a poor mode of transport for her merchandise.  

Oliva desires to grow her business from retail to wholesale and for this reason she is asking for credit to buy rice, ground nuts, maize flour and a weighing scale for her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, ground nuts, maize flour, and a weighing scale for her business.

loans.name: Anatolius

texts.en:
Anatolius is a single hardworking man living in Kagadi, Uganda.  He has been supplying computers and offering computer repair services since 2011 to earn money.  He hopes to improve his standard of living through increased sales despite electronics shortages.  

Anatolius is requesting for a loan to buy new computers for his business.

loans.use: to buy new computers for his business.

loans.name: Mariane

texts.en:
Mariane is a married woman and a mother of five children from Dulag, Leyte. Mariane runs a sari sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Mariane's business was ruined when a typhoon hit the country several months ago. Her income dropped drastically after the calamity.

As of this moment, Mariane has just started to rebuild her business again. She is requesting  a loan to buy additional piglets to raise as well as feeds and food supplement for the pigs. With this, she will be able to raise healthy pigs that she can sell to the market after a few weeks. Mariane dreams of expanding her business and saves money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise as well as feeds and food supplement for the pigs.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon, a married man with two children, operates a retail shop and sells produce as his source of income in Kagadi, Uganda. 

Despite his being hard working and desiring to grow his business, he is challenged by competition from similar businesses and the general price fluctuations. 

Simon intends to use credit to buy more sugar, salt and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Gadi

texts.en:
Gadi is a hard working man living in Kagadi, Uganda, who started farming, and a produce selling business alongside a bar, to fight poverty.  He wishes to educate his children despite bad weather and roads hindering his source of funding for school fees. 

Gadi is requesting for a loan to buy cassava, maize, and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava, maize, and beans for selling.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina is an experienced farmer from Qarakert village in the Armavir region. She lives with her mother and two school-aged children. Tina works for a private cheese making factory and is the main breadwinner of the family.

Tina and her mother are also extensively engaged in agriculture. They are involved in cattle breeding and in growing peaches, apricots, and grapes. Her mother sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of the family’s income.

To continue running her agricultural business in a sustainable way, Tina needs to make some investments in it:  She needs to buy a new barn for keeping livestock. A loan of $1600 will be a huge support to this hardworking woman. Tina and her family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount to sustain their business.

loans.use: to pay for a new barn for keeping livestock.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 33 years old, and a resident of a suburb in Kampala, Uganda.  He is a single father with one child.  Since 2007, James has operated a dairy business with the aim of boosting his daily income.  Using his truck, James also sells milk to other milk sellers of different dairies.

James wants a loan of 5,000,000 UGX to buy more milk from famers as well as buy other stocks of goods for his retail shop, such as sugar, rice, Blue Band (margarine), and bread, to mention but few.  His customers are neighboring shops, and people from various towns.  He faces challenges of inadequate capital, competition, and changes in demands.  James is such a hard working man with a capacity to work if he obtains enough financial capital.

loans.use: to buy milk and consumer items.

loans.name: Glenn

texts.en:
Glenn wants to become a successful policeman in the future. He has five siblings and lives with his parents, who are tenant farmers and live in a simple way.

He is studying to earn a Bachelor of Science in Criminology. Glenn wants to finish his studies and be able to find a better career. He joined GDMPC recently to request a new loan to pay his school tuition fees for the first semester.

loans.use: to pay his school tuition fees for the first semester.

loans.name: Solidaria Mujer Emprendedoras Barranca Group

texts.es:
Solidaria Mujer Emprendedoras de Barranca
Puntarenas, Costa Rica

Este grupo es de la zona de Barranca, Puntarenas, son 3 mujeres emprendedoras, que con este proyecto (Solidaria Mujer) de Fundación Mujer y sus actividades buscan generar ingresos para apoyar la economía de sus hogares, en una zona donde las fuentes de empleo son escasas. Se apoyan entre ellas, se conocen en la comunidad y desean formar el grupo apoyándose entre ellas, reciben la Capacitación de BM y desean poner en marcha su proyecto con este primer préstamo, forman su grupo eligiendo la Junta Directiva y están comprometidas a cumplir con las 3 reglas de Oro.

Luzmilda, una de sus integrantes  tiene varios años de trabajar en el negocio de la repostería, con capital propio y apoyo de familiares, ha logrado consolidar una clientela que le permite trabajar, y vender su producto en la comunidad, ella vive sola y depende de sus ventas para subsistir junto al apoyo de un hijo. Participa  en cursos de capacitación en elaboración de pasteles, desea adquirir un horno eléctrico ya que trabaja con un horno de barro calentado por leña, por lo que este préstamo le va a permitir mejorar la calidad de su producto y poder elaborar más cantidad. Además las otras 2 compañeras se dedican al comercio de ropa y venta de abarrotes.

Ellas son mujeres emprendedoras, como se hacen llamar,  desean apoyar económicamente su hogar. Mantiene un negocio estable con el que generan ingresos, además de apoyarse en el trabajo comunal para comprar comida, desean crecer en esta modalidad grupal y mejorar las condiciones de vida de ellas y sus familias. Manejan su cartera de clientes y sus productos están consolidados en la zona.
texts.en: The "Solidaria Mujer Emprendedoras de Barranca" from Puntarenas, Costa Rica, is a group in the region of Barranca, Puntarenas. It is formed by 3 enterprising women, who with this project (Woman Solidarity) of the Fundacion Mujer and their activities, are looking for ways to generate income in order to support their household finances in a region where employment sources are scarce. They support each other, are known in their community and wish to form a group where they help each other. They receive training from BM and want to start a project with this first loan. They form their group electing a Board of Directors and are committed to meet the 3 golden rules. Luzmilda, one of the members, has been working many years in the baking business with her own capital and her relatives' support. She has consolidated a group of customers who allow her to work and sell her products in the community. She lives alone and depends on her sales, as well as on one of her son's support, to survive. She takes part of training courses for the production of cakes. She wants to buy an electric oven, because the one she has now is made of clay and heated with logs. This loan will allow her to improve the quality of her product and to produce more. Additionally, the other 2 members work selling clothes and groceries. They are enterprising women, the way they like to be called, and they want to support their household finances. They want to keep stable businesses to generate income and support themselves with communal work to buy food. They want to grow in this type of communal approach, and improve their life conditions and those of their families. They work with many customers and their products are consolidated in their region.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and an oven for baking products.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is a married, hardworking man living in Kagadi, Uganda. 

He deals in produce alongside farming to earn income. Jimmy is hoping to grow his business despite challenges of price fluctuations and unpredictable weather changes that reduce his expected profits. 

He intends to use the loan to buy maize and rice for selling.

loans.use: to buy maize and rice for selling.

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en:
Vicent is a married, hardworking man living in Kagadi, Uganda, with seven children between 19 and 3 years old. 

He has been trading in cattle for 10 years so far and farming together with providing rentals to generate income. He hopes to grow his business and open up new outlets in the nearby towns to increase his income despite the hardships of price fluctuations and lack of enough grass for his animals to feed on, especially during the dry season. 

Vicent is requesting a loan to buy cattle for selling.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for selling.

loans.name: Tatevik

texts.en:
Tatevik is a hardworking agronomist from the village of Azatavan in the Ararat region. Her family consists of her husband and two children. Tatevik’s older son works as a dentist in the village clinic; however, the salary he gets there is not enough to meet the family’s daily needs. 

The family's most important source of income is its agricultural business. Tatevik, a teacher by profession, is particularly engaged in tomato cultivation, alfalfa cultivation, and cultivation of grapes. Her family members support her a lot in selling the agro products at the local market. 

As the family’s daily expenses grow with time, they now need to enlarge their agribusiness a little bit. A loan of US $3,000 will be a huge support to them. It will enable them to pay for renovation of the greenhouse and the purchase of fertilizer and pesticides for land cultivation. They will be grateful to all the lenders for helping them to gather the needed amount of loan for maintaining and enlarging their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the greenhouse and the purchase of fertilizer and pesticides for land cultivation.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George, a married man, earns from produce selling, especially maize, and farming in Kagadi, Uganda. He is hopeful of expanding his businesses through his hard work. However, poor roads and high transportation costs are difficulties that he usually complains of.
 
George is requesting a loan to buy maize for selling.

loans.use: to buy maize for selling.

loans.name: Milagro De La Paz

texts.es:
Milagro de 40 años de edad, es licenciada, madre soltera de 3 hijos de 24, 21 y 8 años de edad de los cuales solo uno estudia y es el que depende de ella. Milagro trabaja como empleada y para llegar a su trabajo ella viaja en vehículo institucional, su horario es de 8:00 am a 4:00 pm.

El préstamo solicitado es para comprar láminas y para pago de mano de obra, ya que su vivienda no tiene un techo bueno y necesita mejóralo. 

El sueño de Milagro es sacar una maestría en desarrollo local, que su hija estudie mucho para que sea una profesional y que su familia este bien económicamente y espiritualmente.
texts.en:
Milagro is a 40-year old woman who has a college degree and is a single mother of 3 children, ages 24, 21 and 8. Only one of them is studying and depends on her. Milagro works for a company from 8am to 4pm and uses an institutional vehicle to arrive to work. 

She is requesting a loan to buy layers and pay for labor so that the ceiling of her house can be repaired. 

Milagro's dream is to complete a master's degree on local development, to support her daughter so that she can study and become a professional, and to support her family both financially and spiritually.

loans.use: to buy layers and pay for labor so that the ceiling of her house can be repaired.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay school fees for her daughter, who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree majoring in accounting.

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Uzma is 31, married and blessed with three sons. Her dream is to provide a better life for her children and to educate them.

She is self employed and sells clothes to ladies in her community. She started this business at a very young age with the intention to contribute to the family income. Now she has gained 8 years of experience in this business. She is decent and friendly to her customers. She is quick at determining what her customers want and keeps herself up-to-date about the latest trends and fashions. Now, in order to provide her customers with a variety of clothes, she has requested a loan.

loans.use: to buy quality clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Feliza

texts.es:
Feliza es una mujer de 40 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos y su negocio es el comercio de ganado.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, comunicativa, fuerte, luchadora y muy trabajadora. Su labor la realiza en la comunidad de ‘Batallas’ que se localiza en el km 60 de la carretera La Paz-Tiquina, siendo una de las entradas al lago Menor o Wiñaymarka, donde se aprecia el típico entorno altiplánico.
Feliza es de tez morena, cabello largo negro trenzado, estatura media, viste de forma típica, su lengua natal es el aymara y utiliza el español para el comercio. Su negocio es la compra y venta de ganado. Ella se encarga de asistir a todas las feria de ganadería de su zona y realiza la compra de ganado para su crianza y engorde, una vez que tiene el animal en buenas condiciones realiza la venta.
Su sueño es comprarse un carro para el transporte de ganado. Ella necesita realizar la compra de ganado para mejorar su negocio.
Es por esos motivos que Feliza solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado y con los beneficios comprar material de estudio para sus sobrinos.
texts.en:
Feliza is a 40-year old single woman who does not have children and works in cattle trade. She is an entrepreneurial, independent, communicative, strong, fighter and very hard-working woman. She works in the community of Batallas, located in the km 60 of La Paz-Tiquina highway, one of the entrances to lake Menor o Wiñaymarka, where the typical high plateau can be found. 

Feliza has tanned skin, long dark braided hair and middle height. She wears traditional clothes, speaks her mother tongue ("aymara") and uses Spanish for her business. She works buying and selling cattle, attends all the cattle fairs in her area, and buys cattle to raise and fatten. Once the animals are in good condition, she sells them. 

Her dream is to buy a vehicle to transport the cattle. She needs to buy more animals and improve her business. This is why Feliza is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy cattle. She plans to use the profits to buy study materials for her nephews.

loans.use: to buy cattle. She will use the profits to buy study materials for her nephews.

loans.name: Celeste

texts.en:
Celeste is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy additional stocks of merchandise needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional household appliances and other products needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Celeste hopes that her business will grow bigger and that sooner or later she will have a storehouse for her merchandise. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional household appliances and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is from the village of Lanjazat in the Ararat region. Her family consists of her husband, her two sons, her daughter-in-law and little grandson. 

Tamara works in the village school as an cleaner. Her husband works in a private company as a driver and her two sons are constructors.  However, the low salaries are not enough to meet the basic needs of their family. Tamara and her husband are involved in farming as well. This is an important source of income for them. They grow strawberries and keep livestock of calves, cow and hens. Tamara's husband helps her to sell the fruit in the local market. 

As life gets more expensive day by day, Tamara wants to find new sources of income. A loan of $2,500 USD will help her to buy an ox, forage for feeding the livestock and fertilizer for land cultivation.

Tamara had already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to her hard work during recent times, Tamara and her family were able to find a job and run their agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that they will be able to cover the monthly payments. So Tamara has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for an ox, forage for feeding the livestock and fertilizer for land cultivation.

loans.name: Lawrece

texts.en:
Lawrece is a 38-year old Ugandan man and resides in Nyamarunda in the Kibaale district in western Uganda. He is married to Kwikiriza, and they have 4 children, all of whom attend school. Lawrece is responsible for paying their tuition and is honest and hardworking.

He is a farmer who grows crops like pineapples and bananas, but he is also a produce trader. He has plans for the future, which include constructing a warehouse to store his produce. However, he faces challenges of price fluctuations and bad roads. He has applied for a loan of 5,000,000 UGX to buy stock of dry beans and corn, which will help to improve his produce business. He hopes to increase his profit after sales.

loans.use: to buy beans and corn.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Efraín, es casado y tiene tres hijos vive en una casa alquilada ocupando solo una habitación con paredes de adobe y el piso de tierra, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.
Efraín, estudio solo hasta el bachillerato y actualmente trabaja como chofer en el área del transporte público por más de ocho horas al día, también cuenta con los ingresos de su esposa  que trabaja vendiendo café de forma ambulante en un mercado de la ciudad; de esta forma ambos cubren los gastos de alimentación, estudios y gastos médicos de su familia ya que no cuentan con seguro medico.
El crédito  es para pagar reparacion y mantenimiento de su vehiculo.
texts.en:
Efraín is a married man who has 3 children. They live in a rented house using only one bedroom with adobe walls and sand floor. The house is located in Pasankeri, La Paz. 

Efraín studied up to high-school and now works as a public transport driver for over 8 hours daily. He also counts with the income that his wife makes selling coffee in one of the city's markets. Thanks to their jobs, they can cover their family expenses, including food, tuition and medical charges, as they don't have health insurance. 

He will use the loan to cover the repair and maintenance of his vehicle.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of his vehicle.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y aceite.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower keeps working in her grocery store. She sells basic products, such as rice, sugar, milk and cookies, and works from 8am to 10pm. She has been in the business for 5 years and things are going well. Her dream is to expand the store. 

She is requesting a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and oil. She is happy to count with the loan and commits to repaying as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and oil.
